Title: Transmission Line Inspector - Temporary (REMOTE)
Job Description:
Transmission Line Inspector - Temporary
Job Summary
Perform field inspections on electrical transmission line projects. Work will be conducted in various locations: Rawlins, Wyoming – Craig, Colorado – Vernal, Utah. This work is temporary and will be for a seasonal work rotation from approximately May through mid-December.
Required Experience
The successful candidate will have 5+ years of active field experience, computer skills (to properly fill out daily and weekly reports) and also be capable of photo documentation with working knowledge of Word and Excel
Travel requirement is based on project location
Desired Experience
Minimum 15+ years knowledge of Transmission Line work, foundations and stringing of conductors, and Transmission Substations and facilities, are all strongly preferred
Knowledge of QA/QC inspections and reporting practices
Knowledge of various electronics used to create reports i.e. I-Pad, Digital Camera, Hot Spot, Range Finder etc
Physical Requirements
Included but not limited to:
This job may require you to work up to 16 hours a day for 6 days
Able and willing to travel and stay for a minimum of 6 weeks at a time for a project
Must be able to work in extreme weather conditions for up to 12hrs a day
Must be able to wear company-provided PPE for the entire shift while onsite
Able to lift a minimum of 30lbs or more at any given time throughout the day
Must be able to walk on average 3+ miles per day across rough terrain and/or unlevel surfaces
Ability to step in and out of a 3/4-ton pickup truck several times a day
Required Skills
Included but not limited to:
Must have current and valid driver’s license
Proficient in reading and interpreting plans and specifications and comparing with the customer or engineers’ standards
Combined in the below statement
Proficient in both verbal and written communication with the ability to communicate well with others at all levels of the organization
Will prepare detailed reports and present to the customer in an organized, clear and concise manner each day
At POWER Engineers, you can have a rewarding career on every level. Our philosophy is simple: Do Good. Have Fun. Build Success.
You’ll work on fun and challenging projects and initiatives. You’ll have the chance to make a positive impact on society and the environment. And you’ll find the support, coaching and training it takes to advance your career.
Since we’re employee-owned, we get to make POWER a great place to work. That includes providing competitive compensation, professional development, and a full benefit package:
Medical/Dental/Vision
Paid Holidays
Vacation/Paid Sick Leave
Voluntary Life Insurance
401K
Telehealth Benefit covers all providers
Maternity and Paternity Leave
New Dads and Moms Benefit program
Fertility Benefits
Gender affirming care
POWER is a fun engineering firm. That might seem contradictory to some, but it works for us!
Salary DOE: The pay range for this position is $83k - $120k per year; however, base pay may be higher or lower depending on the candidate's job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. This figure does not include additional compensation such as health benefits, vacation, 401k, etc.
EOE, including disability/vets
#LI-BE1 #REMOTE

Title: Transportation/Distribution Line Inspectors
Job Description:
Job Description:
This position will be responsible for performing field inspections on electrical distribution line projects. This position may be up to 100% travel. Mobilization to and from the project can be provided by RGC Power. Work locations are varied in the state of Texas.
In this role you will log daily reports of contractor electrical line crew work. Observe work and give feedback as needed, while working with established utility and privately owned electrical companies.
Inspecting line construction work for compliance with standards and contracts. Observe safety procedures on and around high voltage conductors & equipment to make sure contractors are following safety rules and guidelines. Read and follow written and orally communicated instructions. Maintain a positive work environment with coworkers and the public. Perform work for extended periods of time. Efficient recordkeeping, word processing, spreadsheets and databases. Weekends and holidays may also be required at the customer’s request. Working in remote locations and hazardous areas may be required. Travel requirements are based on project location.
Primarily responsible for field inspections on electrical distribution line projects.
Work with contractors to ensure work is completed according to customer standards.
Performs reviews of construction designs. Document site as-built conditions in real time.
Job site records and progress reporting with photo documentation.
Verification of construction methods and techniques.
Work overtime and emergency storm assessments as needed. Available for emergency response work as needed. Work unique schedules as required by the customer.
Will prepare detailed reports and present them to the customer in an organized, clear, and professional manner daily.
Be a self-starter and provide practical solutions to technical issues.
Qualifications/Experience:
Any combination of education, experience and skills will be taken into consideration.
Experience working in the Electric Utility Industry is required. Transmission line maintenance and construction, substation maintenance and construction, distribution line maintenance and construction, utility operations or inspection.
Expertise in distribution line work, foundations, stringing of conductors, and transmission substations facilities, are all preferred.
Electrical Lineman with Distribution or transmission experience. Underground and/or overhead.
Experience in but not limited to grounding, voltage identification, distribution transformers, labeling of circuits. Material installation methods, types of equipment construction, maintenance and repair for transmission and distribution.
5 years of Electric Utility Distribution experience. Journeyman knowledge relative to line construction OR Two-year technical degree with greater than 3 years of relevant Electrical Utility Distribution experience.
Strong attention to detail and a commitment to the RGC Power Safety culture
Proficient at using Microsoft tablets, computers, and Microsoft Office products and tools.
Proficient in reading and interpreting plans and specifications and comparing with the customer or engineers’ standards.
Proficient in both verbal and written communication with the ability to communicate well with others at all levels of the organization.
Needed Education/Experience:
Must have a current and valid driver’s license and satisfactory driving record.
Must have a high school diploma or at least 5 years of relevant work experience as referenced above.
Additional technical certifications considered.
Benefits:
Great salary, the pay range for this position is $115k - $160k may be higher dependent on specific knowledge, experience/expertise and skill sets
Paid weekly
Per diem paid weekly
Holiday and PTO pay
Employer paid healthcare for the employee
Voluntary vision and dental
Equal opportunity employer
Company provided vehicle

Pay: $115,000.00 - $160,000.00 per year

Health insurance
Paid time off
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Weekend availability

Driver's License (Required)

Title: Principal Transmission Line Engineer
Job Description:
The Opportunity
Ulteig is currently seeking talented and motivated candidates for a Principal Transmission Line Engineer role supporting, managing, and leading transmission & distribution projects across both Power and Renewable lifelines. This critical role will have responsibility for design and/or coordination of High Voltage (69kV-500kV) transmission lines utilizing the PLS-CADD software, as well as developing the team and acting as a primary client-facing Subject Matter Expert (SME) to help grow our team.

What You’ll Do
The ideal candidate has excellent problem solving skills; uses advanced techniques, theory, precepts and practices to complete complex high voltage and extra high voltage electric transmission line project assignments. They will adapt and modify standard techniques to solve multifaceted problems and provide expert consultation for the design, development and implementation of technical plans and systems used in the construction of high voltage transmission lines. Responsibilities include: facilitating collaboration between other disciplines and project team members; acting as client contact to determine the project scope and understand client requirements; development of final construction documents and ensure quality control and compliance with client requirements. Final deliverables will include project design criteria, plan and profile drawings, structure framing and loading drawings, assembly drawings, structure foundation drawings and construction specifications. The engineer will coordinate specific design aspects of projects, estimating construction costs, and specify materials. In addition, the candidate will be regularly involved in internal training presentations, mentoring junior engineers, assisting with proposal bids, and improvement of internal design standards & processes.

What We Expect from You
A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Civil/Structural, Mechanical or Electrical Engineering from an ABET accredited school. Master’s degree preferred.
Minimum of 20 years relative transmission line engineering experience is preferred
Professional Engineer (PE) license required. Licensure in multiple states preferred.
Licensed Structural Engineer (SE) preferred.
Expert in PLS-CADD and PLS-POLE required, with ability to train others.
Expert knowledge and experience in all aspects of transmission line design and project types, including line routing, engineering & design, construction, structural analysis, clearance analysis,
Previous experience working with or for a Utility is required.
Proven track record of positive client relationships
Actively manages individual workload
Effectively leads in training and mentoring team members
Responsible for reviewing project drawings, calculations & specifications
Demonstrate wide degree of creativity and latitude
Collaborate with multi-discipline team to ensure project success
Must be analytical, self-motivated, and possess the ability to work in a team environment and a variety of situations while maintaining a positive, enthusiastic attitude
Excellent presentation and verbal/written communications skills
Demonstrates strong interpersonal skills with the ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with staff, management, clients and external agencies
Experience as industry subject matter expert, including involvement in industry committees and/or conference presentations is preferred.
Proven experience in Microsoft Software Applications (Word, Excel, Power Point, Access) and AutoCAD is preferred
Proficiency in MFAD/LPILE is preferred
Highly driven toward team success and professional growth
Must have authorization to work permanently in the US

As you consider applying for a position at Ulteig, we encourage you to think outside the box – because we do! You might not meet 100% of the skills listed in a description, but we are committed to hiring people with exceptional talent, ability and potential, and then creating an environment where they can become the best versions of themselves. We don’t want to miss out on the possibility of speaking with the next outstanding Ulteig team member, so please apply if you think this role is a great match for your unique skills and strengths. And, yes, relevant military experience is absolutely considered for transitioning service members.

What You Can Expect from Ulteig
Ulteig is a purpose driven organization that has built a culture focused on people – both our clients and our employees for over 75 years. Working at Ulteig is more than a job, it means you will have the opportunity to make a difference by creating and solving for a sustainable future. We realize that a huge part of our success has relied heavily on the dedication and focus of our workforce; this is why we make investing in our employees a top priority. Being 100% employee-owned means, we take our own success and the success of our clients personally.
We offer our team members:
Flexible Workplace
Employee Ownership
Competitive Pay
Comprehensive Benefits Package
Collaborative Environment
Innovative Culture
Our vision is to be the most trusted partners transforming our world’s critical infrastructure. Ulteig connects people and resources to develop compelling, integrated solutions across multiple Lifeline Sectors®, including power, renewables, transportation and water. Ulteig's footprint spans the country and leverages its expertise with a wide range of public and private clients.
At Ulteig, we deeply care and listen to the needs of our team to ensure they are comfortable and have the necessary tools to be productive whether they choose to work remotely, hybrid or in office. We strive to allow a balance and separation between home and work life and provide support and a flexible working schedule so that employees are able to focus on what's important to them. Our offices are currently open, and employees have the option of accessing them to work. We will continue to monitor and respond to COVID-19 proactively to ensure the safety of our valued employees.
If you would like to be a part of a company that empowers their employees, apply today!

Description:
Engineered Solutions Group is a unique company offering a wide range of experience and education in the area of power system operations, engineering, and administration. We provide extensive services from planning studies, design and construction to periodic testing and maintenance.
We are currently seeking a skilled Transmission Design Engineer to join our team. This is a full-time position and requires some travel. Experience utilizing PLS-CADD is required. You must have knowledge of NESC code as well. PE or the capability of acquiring a PE within 6 months is preferred, but not required. You will be responsible for the development of transmission line design (engineering analysis, route selection, structure spotting, and line design calculations). Other responsibilities include technical design, project review, development of transmission standards, drawings specifications, cost estimating, project scheduling, and project management.

Title: Transmission Line Engineer
Job Description:
Transmission Line Designer
RRC is seeking a talented Transmission Line Designer help us build the future of both U.S. and Canada energy production from remote work locations in the US and Canada or if you prefer the office environment, any one of our US or Canadian office locations.. RRC is a multi-disciplinary engineering firm that specializes in energy projects, particularly renewable energy, throughout the United States. Founded in 2007, RRC provides a culture where employees are valued while contributing to meaningful projects. This is an opportunity to work at the forefront of the evolving energy production landscape.
Must understand & personify RRCs Core Beliefs
Client Satisfaction Understands the goal of always exceeding our clients expectation.
Employee Happiness Able to work well with others, communicate clearly with coworkers, promote a positive work environment and mediate conflicts between team members.
Quality Work - Ability to take ownership, work independently, prioritize workload, and deliver quality results on time while working on multiple projects simultaneously.
Above and Beyond - Versatility, flexibility, ability to anticipate the needs of the company, take the initiative and a willingness to go out of your way to assist others.
RRC is seeking a talented High Voltage Transmission Line Designer (EIT/PE) to help us build the future of both U.S. and Canada energy production from remote work locations in the US and Canada. RRC is a multi-disciplinary engineering firm that specializes in energy projects, particularly renewable energy, throughout the United States. Founded in 2007, RRC provides a culture where employees are valued while contributing to meaningful projects. This is an opportunity to work at the forefront of the evolving energy production landscape.
Essential Technical Responsibilities
Apply electrical, civil/structural, or mechanical engineering principles and project management skills to carry out project tasks from start to finish while working with the rest of the multidisciplinary team to complete tasks.
Maintain project budgets, schedule requirements, and quality requirements.
Learn and follow established company design procedures and industry standards for Power Delivery (substation, BESS, transmission line) while actively contributing to the improvement of those procedures over time.
Take responsibility as the engineer of record for various engineering design projects as relevant experience is gained.
Review or appropriately delegate the review of project-related design documents, such as fabrication shop drawings, for completion and errors.
Review various design codes and documents in order to apply the appropriate design standards.
Perform value engineering design analyses to determine the most cost-competitive design.
Complete project site-visits to inspect construction quality are possible on occasion.
Assist with the preparation of project proposals.
Qualifications
B.S. or M.S. (or M.E.) in Electrical, Civil/Structural, Mechanical Engineering.
0-5+ years of engineering design experience.
Other experience levels will be considered for otherwise highly qualified candidates
Experience in the utility scale renewable energy industry and/or utility scale power delivery is a plus
Professional Engineering registration license or ability to obtain license as well as a desire to obtain licensure in United States.
Must be authorized for full-time work in Canada or the United States.
Candidates must have good verbal and written communication skills and the ability to lead or be part of a project team as well as communicate with clients directly.
Candidate must be able to independently execute project work and be able to work on multiple projects at the same time in a fast-paced environment.
Candidate must be able to coordinate with other disciplines to ensure a quality deliverable.
Candidate must be highly organized to manage detailed project information and prioritize tasks.
Well versed in Microsoft Outlook, Excel and Word in order to analyze and communicate design information
Experience with applicable software packages including MathCad, Bluebeam, AutoCAD Civil 3D, and/or PLS-CADD, Excel, ArcGIS, is highly beneficial, but not required.
All necessary training will be provided.
Must be willing to travel to project locations for short durations (typically one to two days per trip) around the Canada or U.S. at least a few times per year.
Benefits
RRC is committed to investing in talented employees because we recognize that healthy, happy employees provide the best path to sustaining a successful business. RRC offers competitive salaries and benefits for full-time employees, including:
Flexible work hours to accommodate work-life balance
Remote work options
Health, dental, and vision insurance
RRSP matching (Canada), 401k matching (US)

Title: Transmission Line Project Engineer
Job Description:
Transmission Line Project Engineer - ( 170572 )
Description

About Us
At HDR, we specialize in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. While we are most well-known for adding beauty and structure to communities through high-performance buildings and smart infrastructure, we provide much more than that. We create an unshakable foundation for progress because our multidisciplinary teams also include scientists, economists, builders, analysts and artists. That's why we believe diversity is our greatest strength. HDR is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.

Watch Our Story:' https://www.hdrinc.com/our-story'

We believe that the way we work can add meaning and value to the world. That ideas inspire positive change. That coloring outside the lines can illuminate fresh perspectives. And that small details yield important realizations. Above all, we believe that collaboration is the best way forward.
HDR Engineering is looking for a Transmission Line Project Engineer to join our growing and nationally ranked team of Power Delivery professionals.
The primary duties of the Transmission Line Project Engineer include responsibility for knowledge and execution of the technical aspects and deliverables of projects assigned and is an experienced, competent engineer who generally understands and can complete all technical requirements of high voltage transmission line projects of basic to moderate complexity. Assigns tasks and provides guidance to junior team members and coordinates QC reviews for work performed by junior level engineers and/or designers. The Project Engineer will also be responsible for quality control reviews of projects from other teams on an as needed basis. The Project Engineer works independently and may direct, mentor, train, and/or supervise efforts of less-experienced EIT's and/or Designers.
Primary Responsibilities
In the role of Transmission Line Project Engineer we'll count on you to:
Conducting analyses to develop design options.
Performing PLS-CADD modeling and/or calculations.
Assisting with preparing cost estimates or specifications.
Perform routine to moderately complex engineering and design tasks.
Lead design teams to develop and complete full construction packages for transmission line projects.
Participate in field reviews or construction observation.
Train and mentor junior and entry level engineers.
Coordinate work of the electrical design team on large institutional/industrial projects through the schematic design development and contract document phase of a project
Establish meetings and participate in reviews with various governing agencies for code compliance
Coordinate workload to complete the document on schedule
Conduct work sessions at the project site in conjunction with the Project Manager and other disciplines
Review electrical documents for areas of conflict with all disciplines
Write/edit electrical specifications and select equipment, electrical systems and devices
Coordinate with and assist affected disciplines with addenda, RFIs, CPRs and change orders, and take responsibility to incorporate agreed-upon changes into the project documents
Provide construction contract administration as needed
Conduct QA/QC on the work of other Electrical Engineers, Electrical Coordinators or Technicians
Perform other duties as needed
#LI-JF1
Keywords: Transmission Line Engineer, PLS-CADD, PLS-Pole, Civil Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, PLS-TOWER
Qualifications

Required Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Engineering required (Civil, Electrical, or Mechanical Engineering preferred).
Professional Engineer (P.E.) license.
5+ years of experience designing Transmission and/or Distribution projects.
Proficient using PLS-CADD transmission line design software suite, including PLS-Pole
Strong computer skills, AutoCAD, Microsoft Office and electrical design software
Experience of structure analysis, project cost estimates, T&D construction package preparation, optimization, specifications and drawings, and other engineering documents required for power transmission line projects.
Proficient with Microsoft Office.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
An attitude and commitment to being an active participant of our employee-owned culture is a must.
Some field work and travel may be required.
An attitude and commitment to being an active participant of our employee-owned culture is a must
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Civil, Electrical, or Mechanical Engineering preferred
Previous experience with an architectural/engineering or engineering consulting firm desired
Familiarity with NESC and GO 95 codes.
Familiarity with PLS-TOWER and/or SAPS modules of PLS-CADD
Previous experience with utility industry or engineering consulting firms desired.
Experience and/or interest in sustainable design/LEED desired but not required
Preference will be given to local candidates.
Why HDR
At HDR, we know work isn't only about who you work for it's also about what you do and how you do it. Led by the strength of our values and a culture shaped by employee ownership, we network with each other, build on each other's contributions, and collaborate together to make great things possible. When you join HDR, we give you license to do the same. We help you take charge of your career, giving you multiple growth opportunities along the way.
We provide a comprehensive benefits package that promotes employee ownership, employee health, performance, and success, which includes medical, dental, vision, short and long-term disability, life insurance, an employee assistance program, paid time off, parental leave, paid holidays, 401(k) retirement savings plan with employer match, employee referral bonuses and tuition reimbursement. The expected compensation range for this position is $84,847.00 - $121,210.00 annually depending upon skills, experience, education and geographical location.

Title: Entry-Level Transmission Line Engineer
Job Description:
Entry-Level Transmission Line Engineer
POWER Engineers is currently seeking an entry level Engineer to develop their career as a Transmission Line Engineer in the Power Delivery Overhead Transmission Line Department in our Boise, Idaho office.

Title: Transmission Line Engineer -- Entry-Level -- Hybrid
Job Description:
Overview:

Sargent & Lundy is one of the most experienced full-service architect-engineering firms in the world. Founded in 1891, the firm is a global leader in power and energy with expertise in grid modernization, renewable energy, energy storage, nuclear power, and fossil fuels. Sargent & Lundy delivers comprehensive project services—from consulting, design and implementation to construction management, commissioning and operations/maintenance—with an emphasis on quality and safety. The firm serves public and private sector clients in the power and energy, gas distribution, industrial, and government sectors.

Our Core Values
Every decision we make is guided by our core values. By upholding these six principles, we support our clients, employees, and community. They are the compass we follow as we continue to grow our business and lead the industry.

Quality – We provide high-quality deliverables and services through an uncompromising focus on peer review, safety, and continuous improvement.

Accountability – Our actions demonstrate the highest levels of professionalism, integrity, and respect.

Our People – We value diverse perspectives, encourage professional growth, and are committed to providing a work community where people thrive. Our work is challenging but rewarding.

Our Clients – We deliver value and exceed our clients’ expectations through outstanding customer service, personal accessibility, and clear communication.

Innovation – Since 1891, we have invested in the people, training, tools, and technology needed to quickly adapt in a constantly changing world.

Meaningful Impact – We make a positive impact in the communities where we work and live.
Responsibilities:
This position allows for a hybrid work schedule with a mix of work spent in office and working remote from home .

This position will offer you the ability to directly apply your knowledge of transmission line engineering including, conductors, hardware, insulation, structures, foundations and electrical principles to:
Design transmission lines in the 69kV to 765kV range.
Perform structural analysis and design of pole, lattice, framed, and guyed structures.
Perform foundation designs.
Perform conductor selection studies, shielding, grounding and induction studies.
Develop cost estimates and schedules and prepare specifications for the procurement of transmission line materials and construction.
Specify transmission line components.
Model transmission lines in PLS-CADD, determine right of way requirements, calculate conductor sags, and develop transmission line plan and profile drawings.
Review vendor submittals.
Dependent upon your location, this opportunity offers a generous relocation package.
Qualifications:
Essential skills and experience:
This position requires a BSEE, BSCE, or BSME degree from an ABET-accredited engineering program.
Related engineering, internship or co-op work experience.
Proficiency with PLS-CADD and PLS-POLE.
Knowledge of the practical application of engineering principles including basic transmission line engineering.
Knowledge of design techniques, tools, and principles involved in the production of technical plans, drawings, and models.
Proficiency with MS Office applications.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Valued but not required skills and experience:
Successful completion of the Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) exam, and designation as an Engineer in Training.
Proficiency with any of the following programs: PLS-TOWER, SAG10, LPILE, MFAD, ArcGIS, CDEGS, AutoCAD, Microstation.
Experience in writing and providing support documentation for engineering calculations.
Familiarity with design codes and standards such as NESC, IEC, CSA, IEEE, ANSI, IBC, ASCE 7, AISC, and ACI 318.

Sargent & Lundy is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any protected status as defined by law.

Title: Systems Engineer - Entry Level Hybrid
Job Description:
Company Overview
Motorola Solutions is there for our customers when everything is on the line. In extreme moments when a hurricane lands or when a fire breaks out. And in everyday moments when a package arrives just in time for the holiday or when a child doesnt miss the school bus home.

We unify voice, data, video and analytics in one integrated ecosystem to enable individuals, businesses and communities to work together in more powerful ways. To help people make better decisions, act confidently and be their best in the moments that matter. Bring your passion, potential and talents to Motorola Solutions and connect with a career that matters.

Department Overview Motorola Solutions is a world leader in the field of professional mobile communications systems with an impressive heritage of technological innovations and a global base of installed systems. This opening is in Motorola Solutions North East Post Sale Engineering Department. The groups main business is the implementation of mission critical digital mobile communication systems for Government & Public Safety Communications customers.
Job Description Overview

Develops, designs, evaluates, andor modifies systems consistent with customer and regulatory requirements.

Develops system architecture, and ensures the integrity of the architecturedesign

Responsibilities

The customer team comprises Sales, Project Management, System Engineering and System Technologist personnel working together in a high performance culture, often with demanding cycle times and high customer expectations because we are working on mission critical communication systems.

Many of our systems are designed around the APCO Project 25 communications standard. With the growth of data services some of our customers mobile wireless networks are being enhanced with LTE infrastructure for applications such as live mobile video transmission supplementing our traditional core voice and narrowband data networks.

The System Engineer will take responsibility for and oversee all technical aspects, along with a senior engineer, of assigned project from award until system acceptance.

This involves

Final Design and implementation of the radio network including infrastructure, subscribers, and mobile backhaul

Customer presentations

System staging

System acceptance testing

Radio coverage testing and interference mitigation

Radio system licensing FCCIndustry Canada NTIA

Complete system documentation

System upgrades

This is a hybrid position requiring the candidate to work in the office a few days a week.

Title: Transmission Line Engineer
Job Description:
ENERCON is a multi-disciplinary engineering and environmental services firm dedicated to driving efficiency and sustainability throughout energy, power, and related technology industries. Our culture is defined by our commitment to excellence and investment in our employee’s growth and development.
Due to continued growth, our Power Delivery group is seeking to hire several Transmission Line Engineer(s) in mid to senior level roles in or our Georgia & Florida locations. Our offices are in Kennesaw, GA, Palm Beach Gardens, FL, Lake Mary, FL, Tampa, FL. This position is a hybrid position with office and work-from-home availability each week.
Responsibilities (including but are not limited to):
Designing transmission lines from 69 kV to 765 kV.
Strategizing and meeting with peers and clients to determine specific project needs and requirements such as conductor selection, pole utilization, and route optimization.
Working with vendors to identify potential materials, equipment, and new design solutions to solve dynamic client requirements.
Utilizing PLS-CADD to develop, review and check transmission line models, conductor sags, plan, and profile drawings, and verify right of way requirements.
Coordinating small design teams as needed to prepare scoping documents, design criteria, and project deliverables.
Providing clients with engineering assistance during construction, and be available to attend construction meetings, coordination efforts, and community outreach as needed.
Performing other duties as required.
Required Qualifications / skills:
BS in Civil, Mechanical, Electrical Engineering and minimum 4 years’ experience.
Minimum of 2 years’ experience specifically with transmission line design.
Solid knowledge of PLS-CADD, PLS-POLE, and foundation design software such as MFAD, L-Pile or similar.
Familiarity and working knowledge of appropriate design techniques, tools, and software involved in the production of project deliverables including plan and profile drawings, structure utilization reports, and material coordination.
Solid knowledge of NESC, IEEE, ASCE 7 and AISC.
Excellent written and oral communication skills required.
Employment requirement
Ability to pass a pre-employment and random drug and alcohol screenings, ENERCON and client-specific background checks, and annual motor vehicle record (MVR) according to company and client policies.
Must be legally eligible to work in the US without current or future sponsorship.
This job posting is subject to change at any time.

Title: Senior Transmission Line Engineer (Remote)
Job Description:
Position Summary
Actalent connects passion with purpose. We are supporting critical engineering and sciences initiatives that advance how companies serve the world. With almost 40 years of experience, our scalable talent solutions and engineering and sciences services provide the expertise our customers need to achieve more.
The position falls within the transmission department of the organization. The engineer will be working with senior engineers to complete projects that support our utility customer. They will work with in-house and client engineers and designers.
Primary Duties and Responsibilities
Responsible for the engineering and design activities related to transmission line design such as engineering analysis and design, route selection, material acquisition, structural and foundation design, and project and construction management
Prepare project construction documents such as: plan and profile drawings; design drawings; engineering, material, and construction specifications; project schedules and bills of material
Develop project design alternatives and corresponding cost estimates
Design new transmission facilities with voltages ranging from 12 kV and 765 kV
Utilize PLS-CADD to model transmission line design project.
Conduct contractor bid and construction meetings and assist in ensuring that work activities are performed safely and in accordance with plans and established schedules, and in accordance with AEP policies, rules and standards, and in compliance with external regulations
Coordinate effectively with governmental and regulatory agencies and contractors to secure project permit
Provide leadership to facilitate project completion, to train and mentor other engineers, and to develop measurable work area goals and objectives
Function as a project lead for transmission projects
Coordinate work activities of others within the work group and department to complete transmission projects
Provide training and guidance to lower level employees
Initiate corrective action when substation project objectives are not being met
Position will require occasional site visits
Education and Experience Requirements
Minimum two years of experience of transmission line engineering
Bachelor’s Degree in Civil or Electrical Engineering (ABET)
Master’s Degree in Civil or Electrical Engineering (ABET) will count toward years of experience
A PE License is required
Requisite Abilities and Skills
Work effectively with both internal and external customers, including Project Management, Substation Design, Distribution, Supply Chain and Right-of-Way
Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills to facilitate adhering to project schedule and budget
Intermediate understanding of standards and codes such as IEEE, ANSI, NEC and NESC
Possess intermediate understanding of equipment, material, ordering, and bills of material for substation construction
Possess ability to understand interrelationship between systems and component equipment
Demonstrate ability to work with others in supplying information and seeking assistance as necessary
Demonstrate willingness and capabilities to assume leadership roles

Title: Project Engineer
Job Description:
Early Professional
A Snapshot of Your Day
Candidate will provide support to the project team in a variety of tasks that will improve the efficiency of the PMO. Candidate will participate as a team member to develop service documentation, provide schedule guidance, and outage planning. Candidate will provide support including but not limited to, submittals, customer deliverables, work packages, One Drive organization, Server record management, Sales Force updates, logistics, report generation, procurement, and Emergency management assistance.
How You’ll Make an Impact
Supports Projects Managers, Proposals Engineers as well Filed Service Engineers with projects and services contracts
Participate as a team member to develop Service documentation, provide schedule guidance, and outage planning.
Communicate clearly and professionally, (written and/or verbal), regarding safety, (i.e. tailgate meetings), security or environmental incidents, safety violations or near misses.
Coordinate personal lodging and travel and other transportation, as needed Responsible for completing time & expense and field service job reports when performing site, using on-line/administrative tools or software.
Assist with coordination of test equipment when needed.
Recommend alterations to development and design to improve quality of processes and or procedures
Aid project team in registration of assets
Support proposal team with reading specifications for tender, calculating and writing tender proposals based on RFQ received, entering opportunities into Salesforce. Works closely with proposal team and parts business.
Follow and/or enforce Siemens Environmental Health & Safety policies
Perform duties in accordance with customer, industry and corporate laws, regulations, and standards
What You Bring
Bachelor’s degree in Constructions Management or Engineering; 0-2 years’ experience in environmentally safe performance of service projects. The candidate will work under the direct supervision and training of senior personnel within Siemens Energy Transmission Services. The successful candidate will be trained on Transformers, FACTS and HVDC station equipment and controls.
Strong written and verbal communications
Reports directly to Transmission Services Operations Manager and performs work under the supervisory direction of project managers and field service managers. Effective communication with both, Ops Manager, and staff, is required throughout active projects and when awaiting assignment and/or stand-by time.
Applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States without need for current or future employer-sponsored work authorization. Siemens Energy employees with current visa sponsorship may be eligible for internal transfers.
As a federal contractor, Siemens Energy continues to monitor federal and state legal guidelines regarding the COVID-19 vaccine mandate. Title: Entry-Level Transmission Line Engineer
Job Description:
Entry-Level Transmission Line Engineer
POWER Engineers is currently seeking an entry level Engineer to develop their career as a Transmission Line Engineer in the Power Delivery Overhead Transmission Line Department in our Boise, Idaho office.

Responsibilities:
The successful candidate will be involved in supporting the following transmission line aspects:
Ownership of their performance within the Department and quality of work
Alignment with POWER’s Culture
Technical Guidance from a Senior Level Transmission Line Engineer
Quality Assurance and Quality Control Documentation
Project Design Criteria
Project Scheduling
Wire Selection and Load Analysis
PLS Cadd Modeling
Structure Modeling and Procurement
Foundation Designs
Material Selection and Procurement
Construction Specification Development
Construction Drawing Development
Construction Support
Field Visits
Continual Technical Growth
Through in-house and external industry conferences
Written and Verbal Coordination
Both with internal colleagues and client representatives

BSCE (Bachelor of Science in Civil or Mechanical) degree from an accredited university.

Experience using the Microsoft Office software suite.

Previous engineering design or drafting work experience, especially if related to civil and/or structural engineering, is desirable.
At POWER Engineers, you can have a rewarding career on every level. Our philosophy is simple: Do Good. Have Fun. Build Success.

Title: Transmission Graduate Engineer
Job Description:
Overview:
Transmission Graduate Engineer
Westwood Professional Services, Inc.

Westwood Professional Services, Inc. is seeking a Transmission Graduate Engineer to join our team. The Graduate Level Transmission Engineer is primarily responsible for the cost-effective conceptual and engineering solutions to upgrade, expand, maintain, and automate overhead and underground power transmission lines for our clients using various software systems and engineering/construction standards. The Graduate Level Transmission Engineer ensures compliance with client procedures, design standards, state and federal regulatory requirements and safety code requirements. The Graduate Engineer, will execute projects under the lead of a Lead Engineer and will work closely with engineers performing substation, distribution, transmission, renewable energy, power storage, and communication designs. Westwood has a highly experienced and dynamic team of individuals dedicated to providing high-level professional services to our clients.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Work under the lead of a Lead Engineer with a team of other Engineers to complete projects for multiple clients across the U.S. ranging from Asset Maintenance Programs to Multi-Year Rebuilds/Tie Lines.
Willingness to travel to project sites, as necessary, to gather data and interface with clients.
Perform all aspects of designing OH/UG power line projects. (line routing, finite element analysis, hardware/conductor selection, technical support during construction, One-Calls, DOT and municipality permitting, right-of-way requests, electrical one-line diagrams)
Develop an understanding of each deliverable necessary for the project at hand. Including, but not limited to, plan & profiles, structure load analysis, structure framing, bill of materials and design drawings.
Coordinate internal/external reviews of designs completed prior to final submission.
Required Skills:
Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical, Civil/Structural, Mechanical or Multi-Disciplinary Engineering from an ABET-accredited engineering program.

Required Experience:
Professional disposition and the ability to be open-minded when it comes to planning and execution of assigned projects.
Must be able to effectively manage a significant number of projects while maintaining work product quality, consistency, accuracy, and reliability.
Proficiency in MS Office Software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint & Project)
About Westwood Professional Services, Inc. (Westwood):
Westwood Professional Services Inc. (Westwood) was established in 1972 and has since become a leader in many of the markets it serves. Westwood is a full-service, multidiscipline professional engineering firm and serves wind, solar, power delivery, residential and commercial development, and public infrastructure clients and their projects from multiple offices across the U.S.

In 2021, Zweig Group ranked Westwood nationally at # 4 and #21 respectively on its Hot Firms and Best Firms to Work for lists. Zweig also awarded Westwood two national 2nd place awards for Marketing Excellence. Westwood also ranked consistently higher four years in a row on the Engineering News Record (ENR) list as a leading design firm in the country. The firm consistently ranks on industry top 25 lists and receives recognition for its involvement on award-wining projects nationwide.

Westwood provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. We believe that diverse backgrounds strengthen our business. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Title: Associate Engineer PSEG LI
Job Description:
Requisition: 74109
PSEG Company: PSEG Long Island
Salary Range: $ 62700 - $ 112900
Incentive: PIP 10%
Work Location Category: Remote Local
PSEG operates under a Flexible Work Model where flexible work is offered when job requirements allow. In support of this model, roles have been categorized into one of four work location categories: onsite roles, hybrid roles that are a blend of onsite and remote work, remote local roles that are primarily home-based but require some level of purpose-driven in-person interaction and living within a commutable distance, and remote non-local roles that can be effectively performed remotely with the ability to work in approved states.
PSEG offers a unique experience to our more than 12,000 employees – we provide the resources and opportunities for career development that come with being a Fortune 500 company, as well as the attention, camaraderie and care for one another you might typically associate with a small business. Our focus on combatting climate change through clean energy technology, our new net zero climate vision for 2030 and enhanced commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion; and supporting the communities we serve make this a particularly exciting time to join PSEG.
Job Summary
As an Associate Civil Engineer in the Section, your responsibility is to perform engineering and designs to ensure successful completion of Long Island Transmission & Distribution construction projects .
Job Responsibilities
Evaluate the design of electric transmission systems and related facilities based upon reliability and economy, with consideration to operation, safety and maintenance requirements.
Assist in the development of material, engineering design, construction specifications/associated drawings, and standards as required for successful completion of assigned projects (Overhead, Underground Transmission or Civil/Structural).

Develop and review standards as a result of recommendations by industry associations and codes (e.g. IEEE, ASCE, AISC, ACI, ASME, EEi, ANSI, AEIC, EPRI and NESC) related to state of the art materials and engineering/operating methods.

Participate in Research & Development initiatives, evaluate and procure new materials/equipment to improve performance of the electric transmission syst em.

Work with internal and external organizations/customers to ensure prudent engineering solutions are undertaken to special engineering and construction projects.

Perform budget/project cost estimates, special engineering studies, investigations and calculations as require d.

Contribute all details of time accounting to Work plan efforts, including expense and capital time

Travel may be required to represent the department and company at industry meetings and vendor inspections.

Ability to respond to emergency storm and other conditions requires field work during nights and weekend.
Job Specific Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering in Civil Engineerig from an accreited engineering college
A minimum of 0-2 years of relevant civil engineering experience
EIT Certificate and the ability to obtain Professional Licensure in NYS

Demonstrated computer skills in Microsoft Office applications

Clear and concise writing and verbal communications skills

Effective problem-solving and decision-making skills; strong planning and organizing skills; adaptable and results oriented

Possess leadership skills, professionalism and customer/client focus

This position may require driving to Company locations and off-site assignments and events, must possess a valid

A valid U.S. driver's license with a safe and satisfactory driving history

Preferred / Desired Skills:

Electrical utility experience

Familiarity with the transmission and distribution systems

Able to read / understand electrical one lines

Title: TRANSMISSION & DISTRIBUTION Transmission Line Designer
Job Description:
EMPLOYMENT TYPE
Full Time
EXPERIENCE
Entry-Level
LOCATION
Remote
SALARY
Competetive
REPORTS TO
Manager, Transmission & Distribution
JOB SUMMARY:
To prepare detailed engineering designs of high voltage (transmission 46KV - 230 kV) power line projects using the clients’ computer applications. Projects may include major additions, replacements, clearance verification, and reconductoring of overhead electric transmission facilities. An intense training program will be available for the qualified candidate.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Investigates, reviews, and analyzes overhead power transmission systems and components in order to design system improvements
Performs tasks and produces engineering calculations, documents, and designs for conceptual and detailed phases of engineering under the direction of the project lead or responsible engineer
Plans material needs based on a project’s scope and create construction prints
Assesses/identifies load and project requirements (Permits, Easements, Tree Work, Aesthetics, etc.)
Collaborates with other departments, plan, schedule, conduct and/or coordinate detailed phases of engineering
Conducts field visits to collect data as necessary
Manages project e-files for many projects within the departments
Participates in training sessions both on-site and in the field
Works with client and/or construction contractors to develop best design • Proofs in-house engineering projects – Attention to detail required
Complies with project requirements to support the collection and storage of electronic project files within the department

OTHER ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Attends work as scheduled, for up to 8 hours at a time, 5 days a week, in a remote location within the United States.
Prompt and regular attendance at all work related meeting (virtual or in-person)
Ability to work shifts beginning as an assigned, designated start time until an assigned, designated end time
Ability to complete assigned tasks/projects in a timely manner and as specified
Ability to interact with employees and customers/clients in an appropriate manner
Exhibits and maintains the highest degree of professionalism in the performance of all related duties
Ability to receive and understand directions from supervision and management

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Technician – graduated with an accredited two (2) year technical degree and/or two (2) years of relevant experience
Entry-level Engineer – graduated with an accredited four (4) year degree in an engineering discipline
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills are a musts
Ability to apply client specifications and preferences to all designs
Ability to learn and use computer-assisted tools
Effective time management and logical decision-making ability
Strong focus on quality
Ability to prioritize work and manage multiple projects within budget and time constraints
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Utility and/or consulting engineering firm experience is a plus
Experience in utility based design, construction and/or operation is a plus
High attention to detail is required
Ability to work independently as well as a strong team player
Ability to internalize a “safety first” attitude to all aspects in the performance of work responsibilities

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:
This position has no direct reports.

TRAVEL:
This position requires minimal travel.

WORKING CONDITIONS:
This job operates in a professional office environment requiring routine use of standard office equipment such as computers, electronic devices such as tablets, printers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets as well as use of standard office applications such as MS Office (including extensive use of video communication and collaboration platform), and internet based filing system.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to clearly communicate, talk, and hear. The employee is frequently requested to sit, stand and walk including walking unassisted for a minimum of 500 meters to perform field visits/field assignments. The employee is required to drive and/or fly (commercial airlines) to existing and/or potential clients locations, conventions, meetings, etc. Manual dexterity is required. Some light physical effort required.

Title: Design Transmission Line Engineer
Job Description:
The Opportunity
Ulteig is currently seeking talented and motivated Design Engineer level candidates to join our Transmission & Distribution group. This position is responsible for the design of High Voltage (69kV-500kV) transmission lines utilizing the PLS-CADD software. The ideal candidate has excellent problem solving skills; uses advanced techniques, theory, precepts and practices to complete complex project assignments. They will adapt and modify standard techniques to solve multifaceted problems and provide expert consultation for the design, development and implementation of technical plans and systems used in the construction of high voltage transmission lines.

What You'll Do
This position entails facilitating collaboration between other disciplines and project team members; acting as client contact to determine the project scope and understand their requirements; development of construction documents for the transmission line. Final deliverables will include project design criteria, plan and profile drawings, structure framing and loading drawings, assembly drawings, structure foundation drawings and construction specifications. The engineer will coordinate specific design aspects of projects, estimating construction costs, and specify materials.

What We Expect from You
A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Civil/Structural, Mechanical or Electrical Engineering from an ABET accredited school
Minimum of 2 years’ engineering experience is preferred
EIT required and ability to obtain PE licensure within 2 years highly preferred
Proficiency in PLS-CADD and PLS-POLE preferred
Previous experience working with or for a Utility is highly preferred
Must be analytical, self-motivated, and possess the ability to work in a team environment and a variety of situations while maintaining a positive, enthusiastic attitude
Excellent presentation and verbal/written communications skills
Demonstrates strong interpersonal skills with the ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with staff, management, clients and external agencies
Proven experience in Microsoft Software Applications (Word, Excel, Power Point, Access) and AutoCAD is preferred
Proficiency in MFAD/LPILE is preferred
Highly driven toward team success and professional growth
Independently completes assigned tasks
Actively manages individual workload
Effectively assists in training and mentoring team members
Responsible for reviewing project drawings, calculations & specifications
Demonstrate wide degree of creativity and latitude
Collaborate with multi-discipline team to ensure project success
Must have authorization to work permanently in the US

As you consider applying for a position at Ulteig, we encourage you to think outside the box – because we do! You might not meet 100% of the skills listed in a description, but we are committed to hiring people with exceptional talent, ability and potential, and then creating an environment where they can become the best versions of themselves. We don’t want to miss out on the possibility of speaking with the next outstanding Ulteig team member, so please apply if you think this role is a great match for your unique skills and strengths. And, yes, relevant military experience is absolutely considered for transitioning service members.

What You Can Expect from Ulteig
Ulteig is a purpose driven organization that has built a culture focused on people – both our clients and our employees for over 75 years. Working at Ulteig is more than a job, it means you will have the opportunity to make a difference by creating and solving for a sustainable future. We realize that a huge part of our success has relied heavily on the dedication and focus of our workforce; this is why we make investing in our employees a top priority. Being 100% employee-owned means, we take our own success and the success of our clients personally.
We offer our team members:
Flexible Workplace
Employee Ownership
Competitive Pay
Comprehensive Benefits Package
Collaborative Environment
Innovative Culture
Our vision is to be the most trusted partners transforming our world’s critical infrastructure. Ulteig connects people and resources to develop compelling, integrated solutions across multiple Lifeline Sectors®, including power, renewables, transportation and water. Ulteig's footprint spans the country and leverages its expertise with a wide range of public and private clients.
At Ulteig, we deeply care and listen to the needs of our team to ensure they are comfortable and have the necessary tools to be productive whether they choose to work remotely, hybrid or in office. We strive to allow a balance and separation between home and work life and provide support and a flexible working schedule so that employees are able to focus on what's important to them. Our offices are currently open, and employees have the option of accessing them to work. We will continue to monitor and respond to COVID-19 proactively to ensure the safety of our valued employees.
If you would like to be a part of a company that empowers their employees, apply today!
Ulteig is a Drug Free Workplace

Title: Sales Engineer - (ADIP/ASWP)
Job Description:
Founded in 1905 in Birmingham, Alabama, AMERICAN is a manufacturer of fire hydrants, valves, ductile iron pipe and spiral-welded steel pipe for the waterworks industry and high-frequency-welded steel pipe for the oil and natural gas industries. AMERICAN's diversified product line also includes fire pumps, structural casing and piling, castings for large machinery, and specialty rubber products. For more than a century, AMERICAN has been committed to doing things The Right Way exceeding customer expectations, being a good neighbor in our communities, and supporting our employees.
As a sales engineer, you will be responsible for planning, marketing and sales for our ductile iron pipe and spiral weld steel pipe. Our ductile iron pipe is used for municipal water and wastewater distribution and transmission markets, industrial, and power markets including fabrication for treatment plants and pump stations. Our spiral-welded steel pipe for the municipal water and wastewater transmission markets, industrial, hydroelectric and power markets including large diameter fabrication for treatment plants and pump stations.
After your training period in Birmingham, Alabama, you will report to your territory where you will begin developing positive, long-term relationships with potential and return clients. Our sales engineers are involved in the entire process from marketing through implementation by educating clients through lunch and learns, preparing accurate and timely quotes, overseeing the ordering and handling of all accounts within your territory.
Sales Engineer Key Responsibilities:
Pre and Post bid management
Establishes and develop long term relationships with owners, engineers, contractors and distributors
Manages distributor sales force including price, conflict resolutions, relationship building, product training and sales force training to ensure that the distributor's actions are in AMERICAN's best interest
Handles all bids within your territory
Maintains a minimum of ten pending projects
Establishes long term sales and marketing goals for territory and works to meet goals

AMERICAN Benefits:
401(k) Plan
Profit Sharing Bonus Plan
Eagan Center for Wellness
Medical, Dental and Supplemental Vision
Tuition Reimbursement
Paid Vacation and Holidays
Work from home
Employee Assistance Program
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in engineering
Valid driver's license
Good communication skills
Ability to read and interpret specifications for projects
Open to transfer within the U.S. and within the Sales Division
Ability to work with confidential information
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Software
Willing to work overtime as needed
Available for travel a minimum of 60% of the time
Ability to handle stress and multiple projects
Preferred Qualifications:
Technical and communication skills
Familiar with AMERICAN's manufacturing process

Title: Unified Communications Engineer I
Job Description:
Organization:
SHSO-Sutter Health System Office-Bay
Position Overview:
Responsible for assigned day to day engineering, repairs, moves, adds and changes, and installs for small to large projects. Performs proactive and preventative maintenance on Unified Communications Infrastructure systems and related applications and data network. Designs systems integration and monitors systems performance to ensure optimum operations. Participates in the lifecycle of the Voice systems and related applications. Provides technical guidance and support to Unified Communications Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) technicians. Consults on major Unified Communications systems and application projects.

The Unified Communications Engineer I position will be primarily onsite and the locations vary daily based on needs. The primary locations are Sutter Bay area including San Francisco, Burlingame, North Bay Area and South Bay Area as needed. In addition this position will potentially be asked to provide assistance for various daily work and project support in other areas including Valley locations.
The Engineer I will be an escalation point for Technicians and will help train the technical staff.
In addition to the job requirements listed UCCE\Finesse\ACD experience is a plus
Vocera Admin and Infrastructure knowledge a plus.

Basic knowledge of multi-unified communications platforms.

Basic knowledge of Cisco Communications and Unified Manager (CUCM).

Basic knowledge of routers and switches, and understanding of VoIP (i.e., various types of IP based voice products - Cisco CUCM and various legacy voice Private Branch Exchange (PBX) vendors/products) required.

Voice and data network company transport such as transmission lines T1/E1, IP using private line networks.

Design and recommend cabling standards and maintain documentation.

Ability to troubleshoot most complex problems and escalate as appropriate; identification through resolution.

Ability to manage and/or be involved in multiple projects at the same time and deliver quality service.

Organizational skills and ability to prioritize multiple projects and objectives in a rapidly changing environment.

Work independently and as part of a team.

Written and verbal communication skills.

Articulate highly technical user needs in a concise manner easily understood by all.

Customer service skills including responding to user needs in a prompt, courteous manner.

Title: T-Line Designer
Job Description:
Description
Job Description:
Leidos is seeking Transmission Line Designers to work in Chicago, Framingham, Salt Lake City, Portland, Seattle and Walled Lake.
Ideally, the candidate would be within driving distance of any of these Leidos offices. We value in person interaction to enrich your career development and collaboration with project teams. The candidate will be expected to report in-person in a full time or hybrid schedule. Furthermore, all employees will be considered to transition to remote positions once established at Leidos.
The successful candidate will work in a team atmosphere to provide technical and project support for high voltage transmission line projects. The candidate must be AutoCAD and MicroStation proficient, and able to utilize materials from different sources like: client standards, images, emails, sketches, dxf exports and others. The candidate must have basic knowledge of engineering drawing requirements with Transmission Line Projects in order to assist with the development of project drawings which includes but is not limited to: PLS-CADD Models, Maps, Structure Lists, Plan and Profiles, Phasing Drawings, Foundation Drawings, Structure Assemblies and Details, Permitting, and others.
The candidate must be able to track and manage various projects at a time to meet deadlines and assist in the preparation of submittals and must have great organization skills in order to keep up with file management. The individual must maintain a high level of quality and efficiency requiring personal accountability with self-checks to minimize errors, ensuring a quality product that meets company and client’s needs.
T-Line Designer Responsibilities:
Development of drawing packages for transmission projects (Plan and Profiles, Framing drawings, Load trees, hardware & detail drawings, permits, soil borings, route maps and others.
Assist in compiling documents for client submittals.
Proofs own work to minimize errors and increase quality.
Acquire and maintain access to the client’s system in order to retrieve and post project documents.
T-Line Designer Required Education & Experience:
BS degree and 2-4 years prior relevant experience. Additional experience may be considered in lieu of degree.
Skilled in PLS-CADD.
AutoCad & MicroStation transmission line drafting.
ESRI, Civil 3D, and Geographic Information Systems (GIS) is a plus.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work with multiple projects at the same time to meet deadlines.
Ability to complete assigned task in a timely manner.
Must be able to assist others when needed and follow directions clearly from engineers as well as peers.

Title: TRANSMISSION & DISTRIBUTION Transmission Line Designer
Job Description:
EMPLOYMENT TYPE
Full Time
EXPERIENCE
Entry-Level
LOCATION
Remote
SALARY
Competetive
REPORTS TO
Manager, Transmission & Distribution
JOB SUMMARY:
To prepare detailed engineering designs of high voltage (transmission 46KV - 230 kV) power line projects using the clients’ computer applications. Projects may include major additions, replacements, clearance verification, and reconductoring of overhead electric transmission facilities. An intense training program will be available for the qualified candidate.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Investigates, reviews, and analyzes overhead power transmission systems and components in order to design system improvements
Performs tasks and produces engineering calculations, documents, and designs for conceptual and detailed phases of engineering under the direction of the project lead or responsible engineer
Plans material needs based on a project’s scope and create construction prints
Assesses/identifies load and project requirements (Permits, Easements, Tree Work, Aesthetics, etc.)
Collaborates with other departments, plan, schedule, conduct and/or coordinate detailed phases of engineering
Conducts field visits to collect data as necessary
Manages project e-files for many projects within the departments
Participates in training sessions both on-site and in the field
Works with client and/or construction contractors to develop best design • Proofs in-house engineering projects – Attention to detail required
Complies with project requirements to support the collection and storage of electronic project files within the department

OTHER ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Attends work as scheduled, for up to 8 hours at a time, 5 days a week, in a remote location within the United States.
Prompt and regular attendance at all work related meeting (virtual or in-person)
Ability to work shifts beginning as an assigned, designated start time until an assigned, designated end time
Ability to complete assigned tasks/projects in a timely manner and as specified
Ability to interact with employees and customers/clients in an appropriate manner
Exhibits and maintains the highest degree of professionalism in the performance of all related duties
Ability to receive and understand directions from supervision and management

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Technician – graduated with an accredited two (2) year technical degree and/or two (2) years of relevant experience
Entry-level Engineer – graduated with an accredited four (4) year degree in an engineering discipline
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills are a musts
Ability to apply client specifications and preferences to all designs
Ability to learn and use computer-assisted tools
Effective time management and logical decision-making ability
Strong focus on quality
Ability to prioritize work and manage multiple projects within budget and time constraints
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Utility and/or consulting engineering firm experience is a plus
Experience in utility based design, construction and/or operation is a plus
High attention to detail is required
Ability to work independently as well as a strong team player
Ability to internalize a “safety first” attitude to all aspects in the performance of work responsibilities

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:
This position has no direct reports.

TRAVEL:
This position requires minimal travel.

WORKING CONDITIONS:
This job operates in a professional office environment requiring routine use of standard office equipment such as computers, electronic devices such as tablets, printers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets as well as use of standard office applications such as MS Office (including extensive use of video communication and collaboration platform), and internet based filing system.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to clearly communicate, talk, and hear. The employee is frequently requested to sit, stand and walk including walking unassisted for a minimum of 500 meters to perform field visits/field assignments. The employee is required to drive and/or fly (commercial airlines) to existing and/or potential clients locations, conventions, meetings, etc. Manual dexterity is required. Some light physical effort required.

Title: Junior Transmission Line Engineer
Job Description:
Description
Job Description:
Looking for an opportunity to make an impact?
Leidos is looking for a recent college graduate to join our team as a Junior Transmission Line Engineer in our Chicago, IL office.
Successful candidates can look forward to a fast paced, diverse work environment and flexible work hours/work arrangements as well as managers who will encourage career development and growth including:
Engineer in Training Certificate (EIT)
Professional Engineer License (PE)

Strategic Development
Expanding a Portfolio of Business

If this sounds like the type of environment where you can thrive, then keep reading!

The successful candidate will work in a team atmosphere to provide technical and project support for high voltage transmission line projects, low voltage distribution projects, and other tasks, as assigned. He/she will be responsible for design and planning efforts related to power transmission and distribution physical facilities. This includes preparation of drawings specifications and reports to define the scope of work associated with the construction of power transmission and distribution lines. He/she will prepare or review structure loading drawings, environmental permitting drawings, right-of-way support drawings transmission line hardware and structure assembly drawings, material and equipment specifications, line design parameters, and line routing; prepare project budgets, schedules and estimates; and perform analyses in association with large scale transmission and distribution (“T&D”) projects. He/she will provide construction monitoring and field technical support for power transmission and distribution projects. Responsibilities include design of transmission line systems, structural design and load tree development, drilled pier and direct embedded foundation design, permitting, detail drawing development, material development, construction package development, etc. Additionally, the successful candidate will periodically interface with clients, and will provide assistance to Project Managers.
B.S. in civil engineering required
0-2 years experience with specific transmission and distribution (“T&D”) projects
Engineer-In Training (“EIT”) professional certification preferred
Demonstrated excellent oral and written communications skills required
Course studies in power delivery systems preferred
Course studies in project management preferred
Willingness to travel to project and/or client sites
Detail oriented
Leidos is a trusted and technology-focused solutions provider. Utilities and mobile operators rely on our Power Delivery Services Team for reliable power and telecommunication expertise, as reflected through our work with more than 50 investor-owned utilities, more than 160 municipals/cooperatives, as well as a growing number of mobile operators, local utility providers and private developers. In addition to providing engineering and project management services, Leidos works with an established group of industry-leading construction partners delivering meaningful Energy Delivery Solutions. Our recognition as an industry leader is confirmed by the latest national rankings by Engineering News-Record (ENR) ranking Leidos within the Top 10 T&D Firms, and Top 10 Power Firms

Title: Transmission Line Engineer EIT

Transmission Line Engineer EIT - ( 23000126 )
Description
Your Opportunity
We are currently looking to add a Project Coordinator Intern for our Buildings Group, Lynnwood WA office location.
The successful candidate will be a proactive, self-starter with exceptional written and verbal communication skills. Organization, time management, attention to detail and accuracy is critical to this position. This position will work within a matrix management environment, candidate must be able to take work from multiple sources, self-direct and prioritize accordingly, and communicate workload to direct manager.
Your Key Responsibilities
Assist Project Managers with project set-ups, coordinating schedule and budget development and issuance to Project Accountants and Project Controls staff for internal set-up requirements.
