Title: Engineer III - Transmission
Job Description:
Overview:
Qualus is a leading provider of specialized engineering and technical field services. We offer competitive benefits as well as in-house career and professional skills development through QualU, while providing job opportunities in power systems engineering, field services, and turnkey project management.

Responsibilities:
Design transmission structures and power lines for high voltage applications.
Prepare and review technical specifications and drawings.
Conduct engineering analysis and simulations for transmission line design.
Provide support to the project team during construction and installation.
Collaborate with other engineers and project managers to ensure project goals are met.
Ensure compliance with applicable codes, standards, and regulations.
Perform field work as required to support design, construction, and commissioning activities.
Interface with clients, contractors, and other stakeholders to ensure project success.
Participate in project meetings and provide technical support as required.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering (Civil, Mechanical, Electrical).
Minimum of 1-5 years of experience in transmission line design for high voltage applications.
Strong knowledge of structural design and analysis principles and tools.
Proficiency in engineering software such as PLS-CADD, PLS-POLE, and AutoCAD.
Familiarity with industry codes and standards such as NESC, IEC, and IEEE.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently and in a team environment.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
EEO:
Qualus is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate the unique differences of our employees because that is what drives curiosity, innovation, and the success of our business. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy, parental status, genetic information, political affiliation, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in locations where we operate.

At Qualus, we believe everyone has value; and that the diversity and inclusion among our teams is what sets us apart for optimal success. We put people first because we care. Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities. For details, view a copy of the Qualus Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Policy Statement here.

Title: Sales Engineer
Job Description:
RENK Systems Corporation, located in Camby IN., is the U.S. support hub for Test Systems and other special machinery, domestically and abroad. RENK is the world leader in the design and manufacture of helicopter transmission test stands for development and end of line testing. In addition, RENK delivers world class test equipment to other industries including Aviation, Renewable Energy (Wind Turbine), and Automotive.
RENK Systems Corporation supports installation and commissioning for RENK products. In addition, RENK Systems Corporation directly supports end-users with Training, Spare Parts, and Field Services.
RENK Systems Corporation seeks Sales Engineers to develop and maintain the sales pipeline for test bench systems.
Job Description:
Active expansion of the customer network and close contact to established customers via regular video conferences and on-site visits.
Participation in international trade fairs, congresses, symposia and relevant industry working groups including own technical contributions supported by our product managers.
Establishing and maintaining the sales pipeline for test bench systems in your sales region with a high level of personal responsibility and creative freedom.
Close cooperation with the sales managers and product managers for the respective industry segments in our company headquarter.
Support and coordination of our quotation projects from acquisition and project planning to contract negotiation, order placement and handover to the project team in order processing, supported by the respective sales manager in our company headquarter.
Facilitation of the cooperation with internal experts and local suppliers for a precisely fitting project planning.
Preparation of quotations taking into account technical, commercial and legal aspects, supported by the respective sales manager in our company headquarter.
Participation in the development of test bench concepts in close cooperation with product management, internal sales, development & design. Required knowledge.

Title: Travel, Meetings and Events Innovation Manager
Job Description:
By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge.
Job Description
About the role:
Join Takeda as our next Global Meetings and Travel Innovation Manager. In this role you will play a role in driving the execution of Takeda's Meetings and Travel Center of Excellence innovation strategy. This includes driving innovation through input into the strategy, management and implementation of products across the global portfolio and being a conduit between the business teams, Data Digital & Transformation Team (DD&T), key stakeholders, and suppliers.
In this role, you will keep informed and aware of market trends, strategy of key players, and
all disruptors and new start ups in the travel, meetings & events arena. You will also manage the travel, meetings & events technology deployment, maintenance, updates, and communications. This position will have responsibility for the implementation of new processes, systems, and technologies.
How you will contribute:
Input into shaping the Global Innovation strategy alongside the Global Meetings and Travel Center of Excellence Leader and team
Managing the global product portfolio strategy across meetings and travel alongside digital, data & technology teams both internally and externally (online tools, attendee management tools, budget reconciliation tools, mobile apps, etc) to establish a cohesive approach to technology and good user experience and maintain high performing product teams; driving increased platform improvement and aiding delivery of client services (through automation, AI and additional insights)
Drive product roadmaps aligned to the global strategy
Work closely with the Meeting and Travel Center of Excellence Leader and the business, ideating new ideas, understanding and documenting requirements, and creating business cases to present to leadership
System architecture: candidate should be able to design and implement complex systems that meet the organizations needs and understand how different components of a system interact with each other and be able to make technical decisions that maintain harmony in the overall architecture of the system
Responsible for understanding linkages between cross functional systems and data dependencies
Facilitate error resolution due to data transmission between cross functional systems
Responsible for developing best practices, managing all travel and meetings technology module updates, training and developing standard operating procedures
Point of contact for day-to-day operational issues with all third-party platforms used for travel (OBT, GDS, rate shop tools, aggregators, etc) and meetings and events (program agendas, badges, registration, mobile app, budgets, communication, collateral, promotion & surveys)
Assess how we research, evaluate, design and implement automated solutions that meet the business needs in the most efficient and cost-effective way possible.
Stay abreast of technology solutions in the marketplace to ensure we are providing best in class solutions by attending alternative travel, event, and other related technology demos
Collaborate with third-party suppliers on necessary API’s or technology integrations
Attends webinars and virtual lessons for all third-party platforms on new module releases, best practices, modifications, pending sunsets and roadmaps. Applies key learnings to TME offering when applicable
Participates in discovery calls using a consultative approach to understand meeting needs.
Focus on the goals and objectives of the program in order to make effective recommendations and anticipate issues and outcomes
Provide support for technology-related functions as needed such as: building registration sites, and/or generating reports as needed
Collaborate with GDS, OBT and all 3rd party technology company’s leadership on the management and oversight of the Travel, Meetings & Events support team to ensure we are using the resource to the maximum
Be a conduit between the business, technology, activation teams and the various stakeholders, including the innovation leadership within Takeda, and with external partners, technology delivery teams, business leadership and practitioners
Minimum Requirements/Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 5 years of travel and meetings technology experience in a corporate or consulting environment
At least 5 years experience, with a minimum of 2 unique corporate OBT (Concur, GetThere, etc) and 2 unique GDS (Amadeus, Sabre, etc) including but not limited to native GDS experience and administrative OBT access, configuration, and updates
Experience with travel and meetings data analytics, focus should be with either in-house or third-party data aggregator tools, GDS, and OBT; be able to reverse-engineer issues to problem-solve, piecing together backend data (GDS history, error logs, etc)
Knowledge of the technical framework of Cvent, OBT (Concur, Cytric etc) GDS (Sabre, Amadeus etc)
Must have working knowledge of local and global data privacy laws and regulations While managing Pharma guidelines, Sunshine Act and the European regulations for HCPs in all technology deployed.
Understand data driven decision making and experience with data analytics tools and techniques. This includes deep knowledge in how to collect, store, process, and analyze data, as well as how to use data to inform technical decisions
Must have working knowledge of travel data and, in particular, how shopping and booking data is structured (to include search parameters and results, bookings, and other travel data constructs)
Multi-lingual preferred
What Takeda can offer you:
Comprehensive Healthcare: Medical, Dental, and Vision
Financial Planning & Stability: 401(k) with company match and Annual Retirement Contribution Plan
Health & Wellness programs including onsite flu shots and health screenings
Generous time off for vacation and the option to purchase additional vacation days
Community Outreach Programs and company match of charitable contributions
Family Planning Support
Flexible Work Paths
Tuition reimbursement
More about us:
At Takeda, we are transforming patient care through the development of novel specialty pharmaceuticals and best in class patient support programs. Takeda is a patient-focused company that will inspire and empower you to grow through life-changing work.
Certified as a Global Top Employer, Takeda offers stimulating careers, encourages innovation, and strives for excellence in everything we do. We foster an inclusive, collaborative workplace, in which our teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Future to people around the world.
In accordance with the CO Equal Pay Act, Colorado Applicants Are Not Permitted to Apply.
EEO Statement
Takeda is proud in its commitment to creating a diverse workforce and providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, parental status, national origin, age, disability, citizenship status, genetic information or characteristics, marital status, status as a Vietnam era veteran, special disabled veteran, or other protected veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, and any other characteristic protected by law.

Boston, MA

Title: Gas Transmission Designer/Sr Gas Transmission Designer - BHE GTS
Job Description:
Berkshire Hathaway’s commitment to building a stronger energy future is matched by our commitment to our employees who will make it a reality. Our employees are integral to our success and work hard to exceed customer expectations. We provide fulfilling employment opportunities, are committed to attracting and retaining the best employees, and support an environment that reflects the diversity of our communities.


On November 1, 2020, Dominion Energy sold its gas transmission and storage business to Berkshire Hathaway Energy. In light of this transaction, the application process and benefits package are temporarily shared by Dominion Energy and BHE Pipeline Group while the full integration of the gas transmission and storage business into BHE Pipeline Group is ongoing.


Please note: when applying to a BHE GT&S position, some correspondence and documentation throughout the application and selection process will come from, or reference, Dominion Energy. If you have any questions or concerns through the BHE GT&S application process, please reach out to BHEPGStaffing@dominionenergy.com.

Job Summary
BHE GT&S is seeking an exciting Gas Transmission Designer or Sr. Gas Transmission Designer commensurate on selected candidate's skills and abilities. The position can sit at either SC Greystone Office or White Oaks General Office Building. Regular travel will be required if the selected candidate sits at White Oaks General Office Building. Relocation assistance for this position is available dependent upon eligibility requirements.

BHE GT&S is an interstate natural gas transmission and storage company headquartered in Richmond, Virginia, that became a standalone subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway Energy in November 2020. We operate more than 5,560 miles of gas transmission line and 756 Bcf of underground storage in the eastern U.S., along with gathering, processing and field services businesses. We operate in 12 states. BHE GT&S is an industry leader in liquefied natural gas solutions, through initiatives such as Pivotal LNG and our 25% operating stake in the Cove Point LNG facility in Lusby, Maryland. The energy we deliver supports major distribution utilities, power plants and manufacturing. Our premier storage operations provide dependable, flexible support for direct customers and neighboring pipelines. At our multiple interconnects – especially the liquid South Point hub – BHE GT&S services support both producers and consumers, ensuring competitive access to abundant energy.

Designs and drafts complex engineering design concepts into working drawings in order to facilitate the construction and installation of facilities. Provides technical guidance and assistance to Designers ensuring the accuracy, timeliness of completed drawings including the development and maintenance of drafting support software. Maintains and updates DOT databases including the pipeline DOT class location studies. Works independently with a limited degree of supervision. May provide guidance or act as an informal resource for colleagues with less experience.

Flexible work arrangements including hybrid or compressed schedules may be available and are not guaranteed.

Responsibilities include:
Develop timely, complete and accurate sets of drawings for proposed, expanded or modified corporate facilities.
Review drawings to determine compliance with applicable codes and company standards.
Develop timely, complete and accurate drawings for new or modified office layouts.
Develop efficient computer applications for the Computer Aided Design and Drafting (CADD) system.
Develop and maintain drafting support software for the CADD system.
Review design concepts and perform job-related calculations to ensure accuracy.
Coordinate drawing documentation by maintaining drawing files and indexes.
Coordinate and maintain DOT databases
Perform other duties as requested or assigned.
Required Knowledge, Skills, Abilities & Experience
Gas Transmission Designer:
1-3 years of AutoCAD experience is required.

Sr Gas Transmission Designer:
5+ years of AutoCAD experience is required.

BOTH:
Experience with 3D drawings or modeling.
Experience with natural gas pipeline and compressor station design
Strong math skills, including geometry, trigonometry and higher mathematics in order to perform calculations.
Demonstrated knowledge of mechanical, structural and electrical engineering design drafting principles.
Knowledge of national gas codes, Pipeline Safety Regulations and related codes and standards.
Excellent planning and organizational skills and ability to work independently.
Ability to size and design structural steel and reinforced concrete components.
Ability to develop applications for the CADD system.
Strong communication skills and ability to develop rapport with internal and external customers.
Strong computer skills, including the CADD system.
Education Requirements
Education Level: Degree or an equivalent combination of education and demonstrated related experience may be accepted in lieu of preferred level of education: Associate, Disciplines: Preferred: Drafting and Design Technical, Mechanical Design Engineer, Engineering Technology
Licenses, Certifications, or Quals Description
Safety-sensitive position subject to random drug testingMust possess valid driver's license
Working Conditions
Office Work Environment 76 -100%
Travel Up to 25%
Test Description
No Testing Required
Export Control
Certain positions at BHE GT&S may involve access to information and technology subject to export controls under U.S. law. Compliance with these export controls may result in BHE GT&S limiting its consideration of certain applicants.


Other Information
We offer excellent plans and programs for employees. Employees are rewarded with a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package which may include: health benefits with coverage for families and domestic partners, vacation, retirement plans, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, and much more. To learn more about our benefits, click here dombenefits.com.

BHE GT&S is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity in the workplace. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran, or disability status. Our values guide us in accordance with all local, state and federal laws and regulations governing personnel activities.
#EGTS

Title: Power Project Manager - Transmission and Substation Experience - Hybrid
Job Description:
We’d love to have you join our team as a Substation Project Manager in our San Ramon, California office.
Company Overview:
Ampirical has been committed to improving and strengthening the power grid since the company’s inception. Just as an ampere is the base unit for electric current, Ampirical takes pride in being on the leading edge of innovation and technology, allowing our industry to flow forward in a positive direction.
We show gratitude for our customers and uplift our team members who make it all happen. We embrace challenging - yet rewarding - work, and we invest in our people every step along the way.
Working at Ampirical is a career, not just a job. Please enjoy this video about our culture.
Division Overview:
Ampirical’s Substation Engineering Division has recognized national expertise in the planning and design of new substations and high voltage electrical substations and switchyards. The mixture of our talents to offer all aspects of substation/switchyard design services, our trained resources to get the job done, and technical knowledge allows us to design a multitude of solutions to fit the client’s need.

Job Summary:
The Project Manager is responsible for the planning, direction, coordination, and budgeting of all activities concerned with the lifecycle of high voltage substation and transmission line projects, from inception to planning, execution, monitoring and control, and closeout’. This individual will manage PG&E projects.
What we Offer:
We offer a highly competitive compensation & benefits package for all full-time employees. You can review all of the details of our benefits package here. Below are some highlights.
The salary range for this position is $130,000 - $185,000, dependent upon relevant experience and qualifications.
Medical, Dental, and Vision effective your 1st day of employment
401(k) with company match (immediate vesting)
120 hours (about 15 days) of paid time off (PTO)
10 paid holiday days
Flexible work schedule (every other Friday off)
Opportunity for advancement and career growth
Employer-sponsored Life Insurance, short-term and long-term Disability Insurance
Gym Membership Stipend
Tuition Reimbursement
Wellness Program
Pet Insurance

Who You Are:
Bachelor’s Degree in Civil, Mechanical, or Electrical Engineering from an ABET accredited university
5+ years of experience in managing projects, delegation of work, directing others, and planning of substation projects
PMP Certification is highly preferred
Advanced organizational skills to manage multiple complex transmission line projects ensuring safety, cost, schedule, scope, and quality is met
Superior interpersonal skills to operate within a matrix environment
Outstanding leadership skills to build and motivate project teams
Exceptional presentation skills
Excellent computer system skills related cost and schedule reporting (specifically Primavera and Microsoft Office – Excel, Word, and PowerPoint)
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Manage relationships with clients.
Lead a team of Design and Construction Engineers in the execution of Substation projects from initiation of the project through close out.
Represent the project in regulatory hearings, interfacing with internal & external stakeholders, and review project with management and customers.
Manage Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC) project budgets ranging from $250K - $50 Million.
Manage project schedules and deliverables to meet external customer goals.
Manage the development of project proposals, bid preparation, project schedules, bill of materials (BOM), etc. for assigned Substation projects.
Interface with all internal and external stakeholders affected by the project including project team, management team, end users, governmental/regulatory agencies, and vendors.
Report project status weekly and monthly to upper management. Monthly reports require comprehensive cost reviews and projections.
Travel to client sites/field/vendor facilities as needed.

Ampirical is an Equal Opportunity Employer, meaning we do not discriminate based on the following characteristics in our hiring and employment practices: Age, sex, color, race, creed, national origin, religion or religious attire, marital status, pregnancy (child birth or related medical conditions), citizenship status or amnesty, ancestry, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, genetic information, sickle-cell trait, status as a tobacco user or non-user, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law.

Title: Transmission Line Principal Engineer
Job Description:
Job Summary

As part of AVANGRID Networks effort to develop large scale transmission projects, supporting access for future clean energy, the Transmission Lines Principal Engineer - Business Development will be leading Engineering of major Transmission projects development and proposals across United States.
The position of Transmission Line Principal Engineer will support the design of high voltage transmission lines and support the power delivery development, construction, and operations team; provide technical support for new and existing assets; identify low-cost solutions for new project construction; develop project cost/schedule estimates; and manage contracts to engineer, procure, and construct projects safely and efficiently.
Responsibilities
Employ a strong understanding of overhead transmission line and underground transmission line design up to 500kV including applicable industry codes, standard and guidelines.
Use PLS-CADD to model transmission lines to support accurate project cost estimates.
Support bid solicitations and project development evaluating engineering, procurement and construction factors that lead to low-cost solutions in a highly competitive environment. These factors include routing analysis, conductor selection, structure and foundation types, environmental issues and construction means and methods.
Engineering support in all phases such as: scoping and budgeting, conceptual engineering, contract management and design, procurement, engineering design, construction, and closeout.
Responsible for leading and creating new conceptual designs and overseeing the work of external detailed designers.
Proactively identify and perform special projects and studies that innovatively solve complex problems with broad impact to the business.
Analyze operational issues in support of system reliability and operational efficiency.
Represent the company on regional and national committees when needed.
Skills and Requirements
Education & Experience Required:
Bachelor’s degree Civil/Structural or Electrical Engineering with a minimum of 5 years relevant experience required
Professional Engineering License Preferred
High voltage overhead/underground HVAC up to 500kV and HVDC transmission lines experience.
Skills/Abilities:
Ability to work to tight deadlines.
Ability to manage competing priorities using sound engineering and financial judgment to determine optimal solutions
Deep knowledge of Construction for utility environments or large corporations.
Ability to review and approve engineering work done by others to ensure compliance with company standards, specifications, and contract requirements
Computer literacy
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to articulate highly technical concepts and present information effectively at all levels
Strong management and leadership skills, ability to drive change and adoption of new technologies
Able to go to customer sites and meet with customers and developers representing the company.
This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.
Avangrid Networks Projects organization is a place where we are focused on becoming a best-in-class trusted leader in project execution by improving our people, systems and processes to become increasingly effective, efficient and agile.

Title: MST-16 Research Technologist (Research Technologist 1/2)
Job Description:
What You Will Do

This position will be filled at either the Research Technologist 1/ Research Technologist 2, depending on the skills of the selected candidate. Additional job responsibilities (outlined below) will be assigned if the candidate is hired at the higher level.

The Nuclear Materials Science Group (MST-16) seeks a highly skilled and motivated research technologist to support actinide research at Los Alamos National Laboratory. MST-16 supports a variety of nuclear weapons programs, including Plutonium Modernization, Pit Surveillance, Science Campaigns, and many other programs. As a research technologist, the selected candidate will be responsible for maintenance, diagnostic and software upgrades, procedures, scheduling, and coordination of activities within the nuclear facility, and will be expected to integrate seamlessly with other group capabilities. Additional responsibilities include interfacing with other groups, supporting operations, training, and working with the facility cognizant systems engineers.

Research Technologist 1 ($81,700 - $133,100)

Maintain compliance with conduct of operations, safety, security, and environmental regulations. Perform work within established procedures, processes, requirements, or specifications.

Effectively balance work on multiple tasks and projects.

Independently operate and maintain microscopy or x-ray diffraction (XRD) instruments and its supporting systems. Troubleshoot and coordinate updates and repairs with vendors and support personnel.

Integrate with scientist to develop/maintain the instruments and execute experiments.

Work with radiological and other programmatically relevant materials in glovebox environments.

Hands-on sample preparation and shipping (including coordination/logistics) of actinide materials, addressing technique development for preparing difficult sample environments in gloveboxes and open-front hoods.

Interface with various LANL support organizations including radiation protection, facilities, and shipping to coordinate and facilitate radiological work.

Contribute to data analysis, interpretation, and formal technical reporting.

Research Technologist 2 ($90,000 - $147,100)

In addition to what was outlined at the lower level, at this level:

Manage day-to-day operations and laboratory processes for microscopy and XRD instruments in a nuclear facility.

Initiate and play a leadership role in method development and improvement efforts of the equipment and instruments.

Interact with program management, line management, and scientific staff to support ongoing facility funding.

Proactively assess instrument performance and reliability, generate improvement ideas, and propose integration of new equipment or capabilities.

Provide mentorship and contribute to the professional development of colleagues.

What You Need

Minimum Job Requirements:

The selected candidate(s) will perform technical work requiring advanced knowledge in science and engineering disciplines and have:

Experience with one or more of the following: (scanning) transmission electron microscopy, electron microprobe microanalysis, focused ion beam operation, XRD or other relevant instrumentation.

Experience with material preparation of electron microscopy, XRD specimens or other similar specimens.

Experience with data analysis software tools.

Experience following detailed operating procedures, with the ability to learn new analytical techniques.

Strong mechanical, electrical, and related skills to successfully manage daily laboratory operations.

Strong written and oral communication skills, including research documentation.

Ability to work in a challenging environment with strict rules and regulations.

The ability to obtain a DOE Q clearance and HRP certification.

Research Technologist 2

In addition to the requirements outlined above, qualification at the higher level requires:

Experience with microscopy and x-ray diffraction techniques, including instrument maintenance and operations.

Advanced experience with material preparation of electron microscopy and XRD specimens from a broad array of material types.

Strong written and oral communication skills, including research documentation and reports.

Experience in leading and managing daily operations.

Effectively working in a team environment and working across organization lines to accomplish objectives.

Demonstrated success leading or contributing to the development/implementation of processes, techniques, or concepts.

Experience providing direction, guidance, and training to laboratory users in microscopy facility-specific technical procedures.

Education/Experience for Research Technologist 1: Position requires a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution and 2 years related experience; or, an equivalent combination of education and experience directly related to the occupation.

Education/Experience for Research Technologist 2: Position requires a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution and 5 years related experience; or, an equivalent combination of education and experience directly related to the occupation.

Desired Qualifications:

Active Q clearance and HRP

Experience in handling reactive and/or hazardous materials/chemicals

Experience working in gloveboxes

Experience in other characterization techniques (e.g. x-ray diffraction, thermal analysis, Raman, etc.)

Experience working in a radiological or nuclear facility

Essential Job Functions(can perform with or without reasonable accommodation):
Depth Perception
Standing
Climbing Ladders
Lifting 20 - 30 pounds

Work Environment:
Work near sources of ionizing radiation
Work with explosives
Protective Clothing & Environment: Mask or Respirator

Location: This position will be located in Los Alamos, NM.

Position commitment: Regular appointment employees are required to serve a period of continuous service in their current position in order to be eligible to apply for posted jobs throughout the Laboratory. If an employee has not served the time required, they may only apply for Laboratory jobs with the documented approval of their Division Leader. The position commitment for this position is 1 year.

Note to Applicants:

For full consideration, applications should submit a detailed cover letter addressing all requirements of the job.
Where You Will Work

Located in beautiful northern New Mexico, Los Alamos National Laboratory (LANL) is a multidisciplinary research institution engaged in strategic science on behalf of national security. Our generous benefits package includes:

§ PPO or High Deductible medical insurance with the same large nationwide network

§ Dental and vision insurance

§ Free basic life and disability insurance

§ Paid childbirth and parental leave

§ Award-winning 401(k) (6% matching plus 3.5% annually)

§ Learning opportunities and tuition assistance

§ Flexible schedules and time off (PTO and holidays)

§ Onsite gyms and wellness programs

§ Extensive relocation packages (outside a 50 mile radius)
Additional Details

Directive 206.2 - Employment with Triad requires a favorable decision by NNSA indicating employee is suitable under NNSA Supplemental Directive 206.2. Please note that this requirement applies only to citizens of the United States. Foreign nationals are subject to a similar requirement under DOE Order 142.3A.

Clearance: Q (Position will be cleared to this level). Selected applicants will be subject to a background investigation conducted by or on behalf of the Federal Government, and must meet eligibility requirements* for access to classified matter. This position requires a Q clearance. and obtaining such clearance requires US Citizenship except in extremely rare circumstances. Dependent upon the position, additional authorization to access classified information may be required, which may or may not be available to dual citizens. Receipt of a Q clearance and additional access authorization ultimately is a decision of the Federal Government and not of Triad.

Eligibility requirements: To obtain a clearance, an individual must be at least 18 years of age; U.S. citizenship is required except in very limited circumstances. See DOE Order 472.2 for additional information.

HRP: This position is subject to the requirements of the DOE Human Reliability Program as specified in 10 Code of Federal Regulation, Part 712, §712.11. These requirements include on going drug and alcohol testing, as well as periodic medical and psychological evaluations.

426.2: This position is subject to DOE Order 426.2, Personnel Selection, Training, and Qualification Requirements for DOE Nuclear Facilities, which establishes entry-level requirements to ensure candidates selected for specific positions can successfully perform the requirements of the job.

New-Employment Drug Test: The Laboratory requires successful applicants to complete a new-employment drug test and maintains a substance abuse policy that includes random drug testing. Although New Mexico and other states have legalized the use of marijuana, use and possession of marijuana remain illegal under federal law. A positive drug test for marijuana will result in termination of employment, even if the use was pre-offer.

Regular position: Term status Laboratory employees applying for regular-status positions are converted to regular status.

Internal Applicants: Regular appointment employees who have served the required period of continuous service in their current position are eligible to apply for posted jobs throughout the Laboratory. If an employee has not served the required period of continuous service, they may only apply for Laboratory jobs with the documented approval of their Division Leader. Please refer to Policy Policy P701 for applicant eligibility requirements.
Equal Opportunity: Los Alamos National Laboratory is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse and inclusive workforce. All employment practices are based on qualification and merit, without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, religion, age, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation or preference, marital status or spousal affiliation, physical or mental disability, medical conditions, pregnancy, status as a protected veteran, genetic information, or citizenship within the limits imposed by federal laws and regulations. The Laboratory is also committed to making our workplace accessible to individuals with disabilities and will provide reasonable accommodations, upon request, for individuals to participate in the application and hiring process. To request such an accommodation, please send an email to applyhelp@lanl.gov or call 1-505-665-4444 option 1.Employment StatusFull Time

Title: Transmission Line Engineer 2 (T&D)
Job Description:
Description
Performing Transmission line planning, modelling, analysis and design in PLS-CADD, PLS-Pole and PLS-Tower, foundation designs etc.
Structural analysis and design of lattice tower and line poles (Steel, LD, Wood) and loading framing trees, plan & profile drawings, authority permit drawings, wire sag and tension analysis, developing design criteria for transmission line design and create bill of materials, engineering estimate, and quality control reviews.
Developing specifications, procurement support, reviewing vendor drawings
Create accurate estimates for the project to match standard industrial practice.
Monitor and provide regular updates to assistant department manager about progress and activities to ensure projects remain on schedule and within budget.
Provide technical and engineering expertise along the guide to identify, analyse and resolve problems.
Plan, organize, estimate, schedule and effectively monitor all work activities.
Support project team to develop significant engineering solutions
Participate in regular meeting and corresponding with Clients.
Ability and willingness to travel as needed within the continental U.S. to support assignments on
projects and overall office needs.
Willing to advance in career by taking increased engineering design responsibilities by closely working with discipline lead engineer
Ensure that all duties are carried out according to the company's Quality Systems Procedures.
A committed team player able to work on own initiative
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, client service orientation
Self-starter with excellent communication skills, both verbal and written to communicate effectively with internal team members and external clients.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Electrical/Civil engineering, with 5-8 years of experience.
Minimum 5 years Power Transmission experience.
Proficient in the English language.
Computer software knowledge in MS-office, Auto-Cad, MicroStation, Analysis software/ tools, Google Earth, Arc-GIS
Flexibility to work in different roles for different clients both locally and worldwide.
Familiarity with design codes and standards such as NESC, IEC, CSA, IEEE, ANSI, IBC, ASCE 7, AISC, AND ACI 318 is preferred.

Title: Packaging Engineer - Logistics
Job Description:
United States
Position Description



Position – Packaging Engineer – Logistics

Our organization:
We know deciding where to work is a major life decision. At Volvo, we take managing our talent as seriously as we take managing our business. We encourage you to learn more about Volvo, our strong culture, core values, passion for making the world a better place around us and our push for innovation towards the future. If you find that you share these same beliefs, we encourage you to discover the job opportunities that we have available for you!

Want to learn more about Hagerstown?
We work cross-functionally and globally to exceed our customer’s expectations and reach the world-class manufacturing level. We have exciting work in front of us, and more on the horizon. The automotive world is changing rapidly and to be part of this big change is an exciting movement. Growth and countless career opportunities await leaders who are willing to join our team on this challenging journey.

We are the Heart and We keep the Heart beating. We have recently begun production of electric driveline components in addition to developing and producing heavy-duty diesel engines, transmissions and axles for Volvo Group Brands. In operation since 1961, we are a proud supportive member of the community of Washington County and its surrounding areas.
Find more info here: http://www.volvogroup.com/hagerstown

This is us, your new team:
We are a team of thirteen Logistics Specialists, Engineers and Project Managers focused on creating, optimizing the full flow of parts through the end-to-end supply chain. We support the processes of transporting material throughout the facility, as well as, to Production areas on time, in an efficient manner and with a Continuous Improvement mindset. We collectively focus on the Industry 4.0 journey in front of us through automation and digitalization. We are committed to making Volvo more competitive through unique and creative solutions. We build on each other’s contributions and collaborate together to make great things possible. We are nonstop working to create a work community based on trust and open dialogue. Most importantly, we love where we work, we enjoy each other, and we cannot wait to welcome a new team member!

Job Description:
This position will have a focus on facilitation of Volvo Group packaging for the powertrain product in accordance with safety, quality, and sustainability to design the most efficient material flow and workplace organization. Occasionally, this position will involve designing of packaging in alignment with Industrial and Product projects’ needs at the Hagerstown Powertrain Facility. Activities and responsibilities will include reviewing part requirements, utilizing packaging tools to create packaging instructions, and updating packaging system accordingly with contact to the supplier. The position requires a professional with the ability to analyze and interpret requirements while working with cross functional teams such as, Supply Chain, Safety, Quality, and Manufacturing teams to implement new processes and manage change.

Who are you?
First and foremost, you are passionate about what you do and always aim to do your best. You are eager to learn and try new things. You’re willing to color outside the lines and highlight a fresh perspective to those around you. You have an aspiration to want to be the best, to step out and be at the forefront. You recognize the importance of positive working relationships and excellent communication skills to reach the success level needed, believing that collaboration is the best way forward. You are strategic in how you use a combination of both your technical skills and your people skills to accomplish your goals.

Required knowledge/experience
A BSc in Packaging Science or Mechanical Engineering
Or 7+ years of relative experience in an industrial or manufacturing environment in automotive industry.
AutoCAD, Creo experience is preferred
Valid work permit for the applied country if not a citizen.
Ability and flexible to travel both domestically and internationally.
Location:
Hagerstown, Maryland

Are we a perfect match?
So, if you are a person who has a can-do attitude, who sees challenges as positive and is ready to take
some actions? Then we are hoping to hear from you!

About us
The Volvo Group drives prosperity through transport solutions, offering trucks, buses, construction equipment, power solutions for marine and industrial applications, financing and services that increase our customers’ uptime and productivity. Founded in 1927, the Volvo Group is committed to shaping the future landscape of sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions. Countless career opportunities are offered across the group’s leading brands and entities that share a culture of Trust, Passion, High Performance, Change and Customer Success.
www.volvogroup.com/career.
A new era is here. Technologies such as big data, automation and artificial intelligence are changing the way we look at manufacturing and logistics. Volvo Group Trucks Operations is the organization responsible for truck manufacturing and logistics within the Volvo Group and is shaping future industries.
Volvo Group Trucks Operations encompasses all production of the Group’s engines and transmissions as well as the production of Volvo, Renault and Mack trucks. The organization is also responsible for spare parts supplies to the Group’s customers and for designing, operating and optimizing logistics and supply chains for all brands. Together, Volvo Group Trucks Operations represents 30,000 employees at 30 plants and 50 distribution centers across the globe. Our global industrial footprint offers an opportunity for an international career in a state-of-the-art industrial environment, in which continuous improvement is the foundation. Join our teams as well!

Title: Entry level electrical engineer - 2023
Job Description:
From the moment you join us, you will be immersed in a team of exceptional engineering consultants, project managers, and specialists ready to support you in your career. Under direction and guidance of experienced engineers, you will provide electrical engineering in the design of high voltage electric transmission lines and associated facilities. Work will include underground and overhead transmission line routing and design, both in rural areas and in dense city streets, for major transmission developers across the United States.
With guidance from a professional engineer, your responsibilities will include, but may not be limited to:
Evaluating alternative terrestrial transmission line routes, determining the advantages and disadvantages of each route and presenting the recommended route(s) to internal and external stakeholders.
Developing conceptual, preliminary, and detailed designs
Attending site inspections, investigations, and monitoring
Actively participating in project, client, and team meetings
Reviewing, preparing, and modifying designs
Analyzing reports, specifications, and studies
Gaining exposure to project, commercial, and client management
Undertaking a ‘digital by default’ approach in deliverables
Actively participating in our ‘Early Careers Professional’ Network
Supporting our ‘Purpose’ in everything you do
Candidate Specification
We are looking for candidates with a genuine passion to create sustainable social outcomes for communities, an eagerness to develop renewable energy projects, and a desire to strive for excellence. If this describes you, apply today to launch your career at Mott MacDonald.

To be considered for this 2023 position, you’ll need:
A minimum a bachelor’s degree or a master’s degree in electrical engineering, with an emphasis in high voltage power engineering preferred.
Demonstrable interest in energy projects through relevant experience, such as your field of study, internships, volunteering, or relevant association memberships.
Methodical approach to problem solving to undertake tasks efficiently and independently.
Excellent verbal communication skills, which allow you to confidently liaise with clients and team members.
Wonderful written communication and attention to detail, with an ability to facilitate the preparation of accurate technical drawings and with strong technical writing skills.
Engineer-in-Training (EIT) or Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) preferred.
Job Profile
Here at Mott MacDonald, we are experts in engineering, management, and development services supporting multisector project work in over 150 countries. One of the largest employee-owned companies in the world, we pride ourselves in our ability to deliver exceptional outcomes through the connected thinking of our 16,000+ talented consultants. Sustainability and innovation are at the heart of all of our sectors which, in North America include Advisory, Built Environment, Energy, Transportation, and Water.
Other Information
Equality, diversity and inclusion
We put equality, diversity and inclusion at the heart of our business, seeking to promote fair employment procedures and practices to ensure equal opportunities for all. We encourage individual expression in our workplace and are committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone feels they have the opportunity to contribute.

Equal employment opportunity is the law. English version, Spanish version, Chinese version.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, creed, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship status or disability status.

Hybrid working policy
At Mott MacDonald, we believe it makes business sense for you and your manager to choose how you can work most effectively to meet your client, team, and personal commitments. We offer a hybrid working policy that embraces your well-being, flexibility, and trust.

More about Mott MacDonald
We’re a global engineering, management and development consultancy.
Our purpose is to improve society by considering social outcomes in everything we do, relentlessly focusing on excellence and digital innovation, transforming our clients’ businesses, our communities and employee opportunities.
A fundamental part of this is respecting each person’s differences and striving to meet their needs.
Our values: progress, respect, integrity, drive, excellence

Title: Manager, Transmission Line Engineering
Job Description:
Invenergy drives innovation in energy. Powered by decades of entrepreneurial experience and unparalleled execution, we solve the energy challenges facing our customers and communities. We provide power generation and storage solutions at scale around the world to create a cleaner energy future. We develop. We build. We own. We operate. We are Invenergy.
Job Description
Position Overview
This position will be responsible for the civil and electrical engineering and construction of cutting-edge renewable energy projects. You will be primarily responsible for transmission designs connecting the company’s generation projects their point of interconnection and managing a team of engineers. You will have the opportunity to build your own team while encouraged to innovate and actively participate in the development of industry codes and standards to help distinguish Invenergy as an industry leader. As you are developing your team, you will be responsible for the selected engineering firms in to complete final detailed designs for projects to be built. The electrical system of these projects may include AC voltages ranging anywhere from 34.5kV -765kV in addition to HVDC and off-shore projects. The team you build and develop will also be responsible for assisting various project development and permitting team by creating conceptual designs, coordinating interconnection details, identifying, and providing solutions to critical project constraints.
Responsibilities:
Engineering Manager and Team Responsibilities
Build and develop a team of highly qualified transmission engineers
Manage a team of staff engineers and project engineers by providing technical guidance, supporting project timelines, and by proactively addressing resource needs
Provide technical training and training opportunities to engineering team
Provide career development training and opportunities to engineering team
Oversee technical and other project requirements that they are appropriately considered throughout project lifecycle
Engineering Design Management
Develop conceptual project designs that comply with all critical owner and interconnection requirements
Conduct thorough design reviews of physical and electrical drawings: Primarily high voltage and extra high voltage transmission lines
Define the scope of required transmission system design, studies, and review results for accuracy and compliance
Track design schedules, update all stakeholders, and ensure that critical dates related to electrical engineering tasks are met on time.
Support project close out by organizing and transferring all as-built documentation to final project owner
Procurement and Construction Support
Coordinate with internal development and environmental compliance strategy teams to meet project needs through engineering support of development agreements and environmental permitting constraints
Review competitive bids for owner procured material. Supporting the purchasing of this equipment and manage suppliers throughout the engineering and commissioning process
Monitor construction progress both remotely and via on-site inspections and support resolution of any field issues. Attend on-site meetings with electrical construction contractors and in person coordination meetings with interconnection utilities.
Perform factory/equipment inspection and witness factory acceptance testing for major materials.
Electrical Engineering Group Responsibilities
Assist in developing department level and project specific specifications and requirements.
Prepare and validate electrical energy and transmission loss, right-of-way, preliminary line rating, and line impedance calculations
Coordinate with independent engineers and project partners to effectively navigate the technical due diligence process
Assist in the development of new projects by analyzing conceptual designs and RFQ specifications
Coordinate with operations engineering to incorporate lessons learned into new design reviews and specifications to continuously improve quality
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of industry technology through various training sessions and conferences
Participate in industry working groups and offer opinions to aid the development of new rules, codes and policies that affect renewable projects.
Required Skills
BS in Engineering (graduate of civil engineering preferred)
Working knowledge of NEC, NESC, ASCE, EPRI and ANSI/IEEE standards and codes
Relevant work experience (more than 7 years transmission systems)
Ability to concurrently coordinate and manage multiple projects with various teams
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Technical writing skills, peer reviewed published technical works is a plus
Software proficiency in PLS-CADD and other Power Line Systems software, experience with Global Mapper, CAFEP and ASPEN or software with similar uses
Experience with HV/MV electrical infrastructure (substations/switchyards, distribution systems, transmission lines, transformers)
Computer proficiency in Microsoft Suite, Visio, and Bluebeam
Some travel required (up to 25%)
#LI-HYBRID
Benefits
Eligible for medical, dental, vision, 401(k), bonus, paid time off, etc.
Invenergy LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability.

Title: Senior Materials Engineer
Job Description:
Driven by a commitment to research, quality and service, PDI provides innovative products, educational resources, training and support to prevent infection transmission and promote health and wellness. Encompassing three areas, our Healthcare, Sani Professional and Contract manufacturing divisions, we develop, manufacture and distribute leading edge products for North America and the world. We have several locations across the US and are looking for new Associates to join our team!
POSITION PURPOSE
The Senior Materials Engineer is a highly visible and strategic role within the PDI R&D organization. This position requires an individual with a passion for organization, development, and cross functional collaboration. The Sr. Engineer will lead projects/initiatives and work with cross functional business teams to solve for technical challenges. The role will create and drive complex development plans for both product and process developments. Finally, collaborating with key partners in procurement, marketing, and sales team to build a robust competitive understanding and identify unmet needs in current portfolio.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIES
Demonstrate technical expertise in the materials engineering such as textiles, polymers, nonwovens areas important to PDI organization.
Provide product and project leadership to ensure successful development and transition to commercialization and launch of products that meet project success criteria and business financial goals carrying out assignments in a timely, diligent, and professional manner.
Partner with procurement, Ops, marketing to develop and execute plans to gather market data and drive product innovation in support of strategic business plans and goals.
Employ innovative approaches based on available scientific knowledge to projects large to moderate in scope across the developmental timeline from concept to commercialization.
Document knowledge and report research and development work for each project in areas of responsibility
Analyze data and provide insights and recommendations based on the data.
Support the protection of technologies, processes, materials, and products through appropriate use of patents and trade secrets.
Lead and support product scale up and line trials and documents trial reports
Develop and validates test methods to evaluate performance of products and prototypes
Drives strong collaboration with Quality and Regulatory to ensure compliance
Writes SOPs and specifications.
PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENTS
Meet key project targets & milestones for product development projects and portfolio.
Deliver on commercialization and optimization of finished product.
Delivery of reports and analysis in a timely manner
Demonstrates core behaviors and ownership.
QUALIFICATIONS
Candidates must possess a minimum of a bachelors in a relevant scientific discipline plus a minimum of 5 years of experience and/or a Master’s degree with 3 years of experience
A minimum of 3 years of experience in a product development role within nonwovens or wipes industry and understanding of the nonwoven processes and raw materials (consumer, healthcare, food safety, other)
Demonstrated ability to translate customer insights into feasible solutions including concept and prototype development and validation with key stakeholders
Demonstrated success in delivering against business-critical objectives
Experience working cross-functionally with business unit marketing and sales teams
Consumer/Regulated Package Goods experience an advantage
A demonstrated ability to work independently or as part of a team to complete projects within required timeframes
Computer literate (Outlook / Word / Excel)
Strong communication skills (verbal / written)
Able to work in a fast-paced environment with varied work
EDUCATION/CERTIFICATION:
Minimum Bachelor's degree in Science or Engineering discipline. Polymer science, Material Science, Paper science, Engineering preferred.
Master’s or PhD degree is an advantage
REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE:
Strong scientific principles (statistical analysis, Design of Experiments, Problem solving, root cause analysis)
Understanding of product development, manufacturing processes, working in a team and nonwovens fibers/chemistry
EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
3+ years of experience in a product development role or related technical function (technical textiles, fibers, etc.) with deep understanding of the manufacturing processes and supply chain
SKILLS/ABILITIES:
MS Office, statistical analysis, strong communication skills
Previous experience of Wipes / NW / Packaging / formulation required / advantageous
Proven track record of developing and launching new products
Proven track record of developing people and cross-functional teams
WORKING CONDITIONS
Primarily laboratory environment with some manufacturing at both internal and supplier sites.
Travel both domestically and abroad.

Title: Lead Engineer Operations
Job Description:
Job Summary
Will lead the day to day activities of engineers and technicians to ensure the safe and reliable Transmission and Distribution (T&D) operations of a defined region. This includes working with the System Integrity group to identify system improvements within a defined region. The Lead Engineer will review, analyze and coordinate complex planned construction projects, voltage conversions, maintenance requirements and responses to system disturbances related to the operation of the Transmission & Distribution (T&D) System. Approve planned outages and clearance requests. Coordinate work with other departments within UI and other outside system operators (e.g. ISO, CONVEX, Eversource). Lead teams/projects that solve complex problems taking and Able to work independently with guidance on only the most complex tasks. Participates and represents UI on Industry associations.
Responsibilities
Perform detailed, complex system analyses, designs and calculations using standard methodology & principles & other viable approaches. Develop alternate methods or design concepts to resolve problems or to improve processes/services.
Solves complex system operating problems. Utilizes a broad prospective to identify innovative solutions. (e.g. outages, system disturbances, power quality, load flow studies, maintenance recommendations).
Able to create work requests and work in Global SAP platform
Prepare, maintain, & understand drawings (e.g. schematics, one-line diagrams). Develop & specify equipment, assemble documents & other requirements for assignments of complex level of difficulty using depth & breadth of expertise in own discipline.
Serve as SME for Operations system/components (e.g. SCADA). Review and evaluate proposals and projects. Interpret internal/external business issues and recommend best practices and/or process improvements.
Able to lead a Team or mentor others. Demonstrated performance as an Electric System Operations Engineer
Anticipates & make recommendations with respect to customer & stakeholder needs.
Explains difficult concepts & influences others either orally or in writting. May be required to make presentations to regulatory/public entities.
Lead Operations teams to complete assigned tasks, conversions and projects.
Assist in guiding and mentoring engineers in Operations, Manages and provides direction for resources outside of the department.
Leads others to resolve complex system operating problems in non-std situations & develop creative solutions.
Independently apply design stds., industry codes, design criteria, & UI polices/procedures. (e.g. planned system outage and clearance requests)
Duties: Possesses an in depth knowledge and interprets processes and standards related to Operations and underground residential designs (URD). Represents Operations on projects, task forces and studies. (e.g. EEI, EPRI, ISO).
Develop business cases & manage projects/processes/initiatives or teams in accordance with applicable UI / Avangrid guidelines. Coordinate phases of Operations work for assigned portions of a project/program. (e.g. clearance requests).
Forecast, plan, schedule, monitor, control budget/estimates, for assigned tasks or projects.
Assist in the management of resource allocation including developing forecasts and plans to insure adequate resources are available.
Experience in distribution design engineering and operations along with knowledge of internal/external business and regulatory issues (e.g. design criteria, standards, NESC).
Maintains knowledge of leading edge techniques or technology through participation in professional associations.
Able to explain difficult concepts and influence others to change.
Skills and Requirements
Education & Experience Required:
Requires a bachelor's degree in an engineering discipline from an ABET (or equivalent) accredited college/university, 6+ years experience performing engineering duties or an AS degree with 10+ years experience performing engineering duties. Specialized advanced training is also required (e.g. PTI. WPI , PUI, a graduate level engineering degree).

Collaborate and Share
