Title: Facilities Engineer (Construction)
Company: Liebherr Mining Equipment Newport News Co.
Job Description:
The Facilities Engineer applies engineering principles to design, modify, or develop facilities, testing, machines, equipment, or processes used in processing or manufacturing products by performing the following duties.
Responsibilities
Analyzes product and equipment specifications as well as performance requirements to develop designs which can be utilized to improve existing manufacturing facilities
Oversee capital projects including project development, design coordination, contractor management, construction, scheduling, and execution. Knowledge of building delivery methods, local, state and federal codes including, but not limited to, OSHA, NFPA, NEC, DEQ, ISO, ASNI, and EPA are required.
Oversee service vendors including contract adherence, quality and performance
Oversee facility wide security program
Liaise with production, safety and maintenance to coordinate projects
Analyzes engineering proposals, process requirements, and related technical data pertaining to industrial machinery and equipment design.
Determines feasibility of designing new plant equipment or modifying existing facilities considering costs, available space, time limitations, company planning, and other technical and economic factors.
Provides technical information concerning manufacturing or processing techniques, materials, properties, and process advantages and limitations which affect long range plant and product engineering planning.
Compiles and analyzes operational, test, and research data to establish performance standards for newly designed or modified equipment.
Uses computer assisted engineering and design software and equipment to perform engineering tasks. Strong knowledge of AutoCAD is required
Coordinates the disposal of hazardous waste, such as oil, antifreeze, transmission fluid, auto parts cleaner and similar material.
Competencies
Bachelor's degree (B. S.) from four-year college or university and 2 to 5 years related experience and/or training.
Safety: Knowledge of OSHA regulations and compliance, able to influence staff and contractors to comply with safety regulations. Act as point of contact
Planning/Organizing: Prioritizes and plans work activities; Uses time efficiently; Plans for additional resources; Sets goals and objectives; Organizes or schedules other people and their tasks; Develops realistic action plans.
Quantity: Meets productivity standards; Completes work in timely manner; Strives to increase productivity; Works quickly.
Mathematical Skills: Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals.
Computer Skills: Knowledge of Manufacturing software; Spreadsheet software and Word Processing software.
Oral Communication: Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; listens and gets clarification; Responds well to questions; Participates in meetings.
Written Communication: Writes clearly and informatively; Able to read and interpret written information.
Occasional overnight/extended travel national and international as required.
Ability to obtain and maintain a valid driver’s license and passport.

Our Offer
An interesting and ambitious role in a successful international company. We offer a secure work environment with a comprehensive benefits package that includes major medical, dental and vision insurance, 401K plan with company match, paid vacation and personal days and competitive salary.

Liebherr - One Passion. Many Opportunities.
The company
In line with its international growth, Liebherr’s venture into the United States began in 1970. Within a couple of years, the company expanded and completed its production facilities in Newport News, VA for its product line of hydraulic excavators. It was later converted into Liebherr’s manufacturing facility for mining trucks and remains home to Liebherr Mining Equipment Newport News, Co. In addition to its production facility, Liebherr markets a wide variety of products and technologies through its companies located across the United States. The companies are Liebherr-Aerospace Saline, Inc., Liebherr Gear Technology, Inc., Liebherr Automation Systems, Co., and Liebherr USA, Co., the umbrella company for eight divisions that are positioned across the United States.

Title: Transmission Operations Engineer (Level Senior - Principal)
Job Description:
As an engineer for Georgia System Operations Corporation (GSOC), a member of the electric utility industry, you will support the GSOC System Control Center (SCC) by providing expertise in the following areas:
Ensure one-line diagrams are accurate and relay data sheets/operating instructions are up-to-date.
Analyze forced outages and significant events
Provide engineering support to the GSOC Operators.
Depending on seniority level, you will be expected to provide technical recommendations and detailed presentations on Integrated Transmission System operations, switching issues, and SCADA requirements to all levels of GSOC and other business partners. The successful engineer will learn and understand engineering standards, NERC Reliability Standards, and security standards of the Integrated Transmission System of Georgia. From that knowledge, you will create and/or modify GSOC guidelines, procedures, and policies to support the GSOC SCC.
As a representative of GSOC Operations, you will coordinate with various departments on:
Outages and operating conditions
SCADA Alarm Issues
Equipment mis-operations
Metering issues
RTU end to end testing
Education
Bachelor Degree in Engineering or a related field
Experience
Senior Engineer: 6-9 years engineering experience in supporting transmission control room operations in an electric utility company or in an engineering position performing planning, design, protection & controls, or project management for transmission or distribution systems. Should be knowledgeable in most of the following areas: ECS network modeling and applications, NERC standards relating to transmission planning and operation, switching practices, substation design practices, system protection and control, project management practices, SCADA systems.
Principal Engineer: At least ten years of experience in the electric utility industry as outlined above for the Senior level. Experience could include Transmission Planning, Protection, Relaying, or Field Test Engineering.
Equivalent Experience
Senior: Bachelor Degree in Engineering or a related field with five years engineering experience in one or more of the above stated areas and an additional five years of experience in other electric utility related areas.
Principal: Bachelor Degree in Engineering or a related field with five years engineering experience in one or more of the above stated areas and an additional ten years of experience in other electric utility related areas.
Licenses, Certifications, and/or Registrations
EIT or PE certification desired but not required. Must be certified (or become certified in 6 months) to perform switching on the ITS and maintain an adequate level of competence. Must obtain and maintain Bulk Electric System Cyber Authorized Status as defined in GSOC's CIP Cyber Security Policy 301 and NERC Reliability Standard CIP 004 - Personnel Risk Assessment.
Specialized Skills
Knowledge of Transmission Operations and Planning with specific background in four of the following areas: Transmission switching, distribution substation switching, substation maintenance, substation protective relay operation, settings, and testing, load flow analysis, reliability reporting, system event/outage analysis and investigation. Must be proficient in PC spreadsheet and database applications. Experience with utility energy management systems desired. Excellent oral/written communication skills and effective speaking/presentation abilities.

Title: Applications Engineer
Job Description:
RENK Systems Corporation, located in Camby IN., is the U.S. support hub for Test Systems and other special machinery, domestically and abroad. RENK is the world leader in the design and manufacture of helicopter transmission test stands for development and end of line testing. In addition, RENK delivers world class test equipment to other industries including Aviation, Renewable Energy (Wind Turbine), and Automotive.
RENK Systems Corporation supports installation and commissioning for RENK products. In addition, RENK Systems Corporation directly supports end-users with Training, Spare Parts, and Field Services.
Job Description:
Conception
Participate in requirements engineering by analyzing contract documents and clarifying issues with the customer and suppliers.
Create automation requirements specification and system overviews, signal flow/controller and sequence concepts and maintain and develop these concept documents.
Create work packages and schedules in conjunction with the team and project manager.
Application Development
Programming of test bench functions, system units and interfaces in the main automation system RDDS and possibly subordinate control systems.
Creation of the user interface and creation of test configurations and test programs.
Implementation of data outputs and data evaluations.
Creation of the safety control system on the basis of the safety concepts.
Commissioning
Performing commissioning together with commissioning department staff.
Testing of simple and complex test bench functions and sequence programs.
Assisting in the acceptance of equipment.
Conduct training for the various operators.
Documentation
Update the automation requirement specification as internal documentation.
Assist in the preparation of customer documentation, primarily in the area of equipment operation and automated procedures.
Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree and minimum 4 years of prior relevant experience.
Studies in electrical engineering, mechatronics or similar.
Knowledge of mechanics, hydraulics, pneumatics, electrics/electronics, drive technology.
Knowledge in control engineering and control of machine processes.
Basic knowledge of fieldbus technologies, preferably EtherCAT, Profibus and CAN.
Knowledge of Beckhoff TwinCAT, PLC languages, MS Office Word/Excel, MS Visio.
Willingness to travel 30%.
Good English language skills spoken/written.

Title: Associate Protection & Control Engineer
Job Description:
Description
At Exelon, we've got a place for you!

Join the nation's leading competitive energy provider, with one of the largest electricity generation portfolios and retail customer bases in the country. You will be part of a family of companies that strives for the highest standards of power generation, competitive energy sales, and energy delivery. Our team of outstanding professionals is focused on performance, thought leadership, innovation, and the power of ideas that come from a diverse and inclusive workforce.

Exelon will provide you the tools and resources you need to design, build and enhance a successful career. We are also dedicated to motivating the success of our employees through competitive base salary, incentives, and health and retirement benefits.

Join Exelon and share your passion at a forward-thinking Fortune 100 company. Establish yourself in a place where you can truly shine and create a brighter, more sustainable tomorrow. Energize your career at Exelon!

PRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITION

Seeking an Associate Engineer with a Bachelor and/or Masters of Science degree in Electrical, Computer & Cybersecurity Engineering and preferred elective focus on Power Systems, Control Systems, Electronics and Communications & Signal Processing. General proficiency required in standard software applications (i.e. Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Project, Outlook), specialized business technologies/applications, industry/compliance standards and written/oral communication skills.
Job Summary:
Provides technical knowledge to develop/support engineering analysis, activities and programs. Performs engineering tasks associated with a critical or analytical engineering project or a small number of complex projects that require specialized knowledge in several electric utility protection & control systems. Performs assignments while acting independently under the guidance of a Senior Engineer.
Tasks:
Read and interpret complex electrical drawings to include but not limited to protection, metering, controls, and communications associated with transmission and distribution electric-utility substation engineering documentation.
Create design documents and drawings for substation projects including scope documents, one line diagrams, AC & DC schematic diagrams, wiring diagrams, bills of materials, and applying field mark-ups of project as-built drawings with minimal supervision.
Follow procedures/job process to include preparation of QA checklists and reports for compliance with design configuration control policies and regulatory compliance requirements.
Maintain understanding of NERC PRC & CIP Standards, following policies and procedures to ensure compliance with the requirements.
Provide technical engineering support to field construction, testing and commissioning crews.
Use PC based word processing, spreadsheet, database, and e-mail software to perform work duties in addition to utilizing engineering application software to complete engineering tasks such as relay coordination, load flow and short circuit studies.
Code/program intelligent electronic devices (IEDs)/PLCs/RTUs, develop alarm and SCADA communication point lists, and prepare test plans. Understanding of communication protocols such as DNP3, architectures such a serial and routable communications, and programming languages, and tools such as advance application developments in Excel, Mathcad, etc.
Qualifications
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering
Ability to analyze and interpret complex electrical and mechanical systems.
Knowledge and ability to apply problem solving approaches and engineering theory.
Knowledge of engineering designs, principles and practices.
Zero to two years of professional engineering experience
Limited knowledge and experience with regulations, guides, standards, codes, methods, and practices necessary to perform routine assignments for a specific discipline installations, or service.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Written and oral communication/presentation skills, report generation & technical writing skills
Interpersonal skills & the ability to collaborate with peers
Ability to confer with customers and identify customer needs

Exelon is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and employees or applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to: age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law.

Title: Pipeline Integrity Risk Assessment & Data Science Engineer(Hybrid Schedule)
Job Description:
About Us

At SoCalGas, we believe that every Californian deserves a resilient energy future. We are working to achieve that future by empowering California to reach its sustainability goals through innovation, collaboration, and decarbonization. As our state’s energy needs change, we will be there providing reliable energy that is clean, safe, and affordable to our 22 million customers.

In addition to helping shape the future of hydrogen technology and clean energy, as an employee of SoCalGas you’ll also enjoy an aggressive total compensation plan, multiple upward mobility opportunities and the ability to find a true work life balance. We also strive to reflect the communities we serve by attracting top talent and maintaining a diverse workforce. To discover more about how rewarding it is to work here, we invite you to visit these pages on our website: Our Mission; Diversity, Equity and Inclusion, Sustainability, In the Community, and Employee Benefits. Join SoCalGas today to share in our mission to build the cleanest, safest, and most innovative energy company in America!

Position Summary

Applies superior technical expertise in engineering risk assessment principles and creative analytical ability to perform multi-dimensional systematic risk analysis in an often ambiguous and complex environment. Functions as a company expert in Risk and Threat assessment and potentially in other critical engineering disciplines. Provides increasingly integrated, data-driven and quantified safety and reliability assessments covering the full spectrum of Integrity Management Program assets including Transmission Pipeline Integrity Management Program (TIMP), Storage Integrity Program (SIMP), Distribution Integrity Management Program (DIMP) and Risk Assessment and Facilities Integrity Management Program (FIMP). Leverages a high level of technical expertise across a broad range of engineering disciplines to enable effective likelihood of failure and consequence of failure modeling. Integrates and balances findings in consideration of the full Integrity Management System, safety, regulatory compliance, and business need. Identifies and measures the effects of Preventative & Mitigative actions on system threats. Formulates analysis outcomes and serves as a key technical advisor to senior management to drive risk differentiation that will enable optimized resource decisions and potentially new programs. Plays a critical role in regulation and program development across all Integrity Management Programs to ensure the integrity of company assets are being managed based on comprehensive threat evaluation and risk assessment.

Area of risk & threat assessment: Data science using large data sets and data models.

Duties and Responsibilities

Performs Threat Evaluation and Risk Assessment of mature and complex Transmission Pipelines, Storage, Facilities and Gas Distribution Assets by applying engineering risk assessment principles toward increasingly integrated, data-driven, and quantified safety and reliability. Performs work with a high degree of autonomy and only high-level guidance and review of higher impact work for progress towards objectives. Aggregates results, in an often ambiguous environment and circumstances, from a broad range of technical disciplines, including but not limited to: - Geotechnical- Structural integrity/reliability theory- Assessment including non-destructive evaluation- Corrosion control, Fracture mechanics- Materials science, Statistics- Machine learning- Pipeline design- Human factors Translates complex results into a unified and integrated risk framework that clearly expresses threat likelihood, consequence, and business value (return on investment) balanced with safety and regulatory compliance. Creates solutions to highly complex issues independently or leads effort to collaboratively develop them.
Functions as a company expert in risk and threat assessment and potentially in some of the above specific engineering disciplines. Uses in-depth knowledge in regulations, standards, and evaluation of risk regarding integrity management programs to provide technical expertise to various project teams in System Integrity, Gas Engineering and Gas Operation Organizations. Leverages comprehensive understanding of different organizations in engineering and operations, and their distinct processes, services, and responsibilities to effectively lead and advise cross-functional teams. Manages and directs programs and/or projects that span multiple departments which provide department, division, or company-wide benefits. Makes decisions with impact on activities of his or her organization. Develops vision and directs team members, both Company employees and outside contractors, to achieve results and goals. Integrates input from, and participation with, various departments within the Company as needed to meet project objectives. May participate in the development of testimony for regulatory proceedings.
Develops new and improves existing Company standards, specifications, procedures and policies governing TIMP, SIMP, FIMP and DIMP, specifically regarding Threat Identification and Risk Assessment. Develops new programs related to research & development which may result from risk and threat analysis.
Communicates complex information with all levels of stakeholders, including senior management presentations. Confidently conveys thoughts, ideas, and/or solutions to management, while being respectful and mindful of other's contributions to the same discussion. Influences other leaders across the organization, as well as external stakeholders, to accomplish objectives.
Provides technical advice and may formally supervise a few less experienced staff members and reviews technical results, evaluations and analyses. Provides for the development of less experienced staff within the work group through mentoring and providing technical guidance.
Interprets state and federal codes, industry standards and Company specifications. Participates in industry and regulatory committees and provides technical input to external regulatory agencies for the review of proposed changes to regulatory requirements affecting codes and standards. Recommends modifications to Company policy and procedures that reflect regulatory changes. Stays abreast of the latest changes, trends and technological advancements in the industry through attendance at conferences and seminars, continuing education, literature, etc.
Performs other duties as assigned (no more than 5% of duties).
$118900 - $178400 / year

#scgjobs

NOTE: This position can be filled at a different level based on the final scope of job responsibilities and job requirements.

Education

Bachelor's Degree in Engineering is required.
Master's Degree Engineering or Mathematics Preferred
Experience

10 years Engineering experience including 6 yrs related to risk or reliability or threat evaluation or integrity management. Required OR
8 years Engineering experience including 4 yrs related to risk or reliability or threat evaluation or integrity management. Required
Preferred focus on integrity management and/or risk engineering in Data Science. Preferred
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Engineering & Technical Knowledge: Must have a thorough, up-to-date knowledge of specific engineering disciplines to analyze and solve problems as appropriate to area of assigned responsibility. Then able to implement the practical application. Advanced
Engineering & Technical Knowledge: Must be able to understand and analyze highly theoretical problems which are difficult to define, have rapidly changing variables, and for which engineering precedents are incomplete or lacking. Advanced
Creativity, Innovation & Problem Solving: Must possess the ability to propose innovative solutions to unique problems, which are complex and/or impact Company operations, compliance and system integrity, with thoughtful consideration of technical, operational, and economic issues, and may link new concepts and technologies. Advanced
Creativity, Innovation & Problem Solving: Must demonstrate ability to review complex problems, open-ended problems, and propose innovative solutions, which involve technical, operational, economic and strategic issues, and may link new concepts and technologies. Advanced
Project Management Skills: Must possess developed project management skills (e.g., leadership, communication, team management, scheduling, negotiation, decision-making, problem-solving, cost control, risk management, adaptability, execution) and concepts, and understands how it applies to their work. Intermediate
Project Management Skills: Assess the abilities within the work group, appropriately delegate project work to team members, and responsible for providing team goals and evaluating performance. Intermediate
Project Management Skills: Ability to assess the potential financial impact of a project in the Company, as well as the impact on existing Company facilities, programs, marketing and operating philosophies and procedures. Intermediate
Communication Skills: Possesses advanced oral and written communication skills. Advanced
Communication Skills: Effectively interacts with various departments to maintain open lines of communication. Advanced
Communication Skills: Clearly and concisely communicates technical and non-technical information and concepts with all levels of management in both formal and informal settings. Advanced
Communication Skills: Must be able to prepare clear and comprehensive oral and written communication on technical and non-technical matters for Executives. Advanced
Financial Acumen & Accountability: Ability to understand and use financial concepts, such as budgeting, forecasting and reporting. Intermediate
Financial Acumen & Accountability: Ability to manage cost and resources, and development of metrics. Intermediate
Company, Industry & Regulatory Awareness: Ability to interpret state and federal codes, industry standards and Gas Standards for clients. Advanced
Knowledge of risk or reliability analysis methodologies. Advanced
Knowledge of pipeline risk management or risk analysis is highly desirable. Intermediate
Knowledge of federal code, state code and other industry standards relating to natural gas business. Advanced
Licenses and Certifications

Registration as a Professional Engineer in the state of California (PE) Preferred
Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) and Engineer in Training (EIT) Preferred
Other technical discipline and business training is desirable (e.g., statistics, finance, data management) Preferred
Benefits

SoCalGas offers a comprehensive benefits program to help support employees both personally and professionally. These benefits include, but are not limited to:

Competitive pay & Annual Bonus program
Medical, dental, and vision packages (plus free Mental Health resources/sessions)
401K company match & Company provided Pension Plan
Work/Life Balance including generous PTO
Wellness Programs/Classes
Tuition/Education Reimbursement
Career Development Tools & Resources through SoCalGas University
Follow us on social media to stay current with what we’ve been up to on Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram.

ENTRUST Solutions Group, an ENR Top 100 company, is a community of people, 3,000+ strong, who are committed to our clients and each other. We are diverse, talented, dedicated, and wholly focused on not only meeting the needs of our clients but exceeding their expectations.

Position Summary

The Lead Commissioning/Test Engineer (LCTE) will act as an agent for the Client and have responsibility for developing and/or reviewing test plans, commissioning plans, job sequence instructions for substation and line contractors performing additions and modification to the Electrical Transmission Lines, Substations, controls, SCADA, relay protection circuits and associated equipment. These plans shall be in accordance with Clients’ testing procedures.

The LCTE shall be capable of reviewing and approving in accordance with Client acceptance testing guideline to include but not limited to:
Cut-over write ups
Engineering changes
Reviewing changes to One Lines, three Lines, Schematics and wiring prints after issue
Testing sequence Write ups
Testing/Commissioning Plans
Job Sequences
Job Cut-over Write ups
Track Changes requiring Client approval
The LCTE shall become proficient in the following Client procedures and instructions.

Qualifications:
The LCTE shall meet the below qualifications:
10 years of commissioning and testing experience validated with a resume and contact information.
345kV to 69kV experience in line and substation work.
An Associate/Bachelor Degree in Electrical Engineering is preferred; however, 10 years of experience can be substituted for the education requirements.
The position may require extensive overtime and travel to various locations in New England and New York.
This position will typically report to the Client Project Responsibilities

Title: Sr Project Manager - Substation and Transmission LIne
Job Description:
Purpose

As part of AVANGRID Networks effort to develop large scale transmission projects, supporting access for future clean energy, the Sr. Project Manager – Substation and Transmission Line will be leading the Development, Engineering & Construction of major Transmission projects development and proposals across United States.
Responsibility includes meeting corporate goals for capital investment, managing Construction Work in Progress, and energization of projects. Must manage team performance to maximize the effectiveness of capital budget delivery considering the environment, operating efficiency, regulatory, CWIP and operational needs. Identifying low-cost solutions for new project construction; market analysis; develop project cost/schedule estimates; and manage negotiations and contracts to engineer, procure, and construct projects safely and efficiently.
Coordinate activities of project team members including engineers, construction managers, and external contractors. Facilitates the work of external contractors and other internal business areas. Holds contractors accountable for performance. Holds project team members accountable for results. Responsible for the overall project control and reporting, providing leadership and coordination of the scheduling, cost controlling and reporting processes and functions. Ensure projects are delivered on schedule, within budget and in conformance to quality and engineering standards. This position is based in Rochester, NY or Portland, ME on a Hybrid schedule.
Responsibilities

Participates in project team scheduling and budgetary planning processes. Informs management and project teams regarding cost and schedule performance variances and corrective action required.
Works within the project unit, managing internal and external project resources. Sets unit goals and direction to align and undertakes action plans, program management to accomplish goals.
Analyzes project unit performance and initiates actions to control scope, schedule, and cost performance. Proactive approach to overseeing work measures progress and takes actions to ensure budgets and deadlines are achieved. Approves project plans, executes contract strategies to undertake work and controls and authorizes expenditures. Initiates actions to ensure compliance with a project management and quality management processes and procedures. Assures that projects are completed within the approved scope, schedule, and budget
Considers innovative ways to undertake work, promoting automation and efficiencies in day-to-day workstreams. Manage document control.
Provides recommendations on policies and goals desired and implements new/revised processes and procedures according to established guidelines
Responsible for Project accountability overview, making sure that it complies with FERC, NERC and any other applicable regulation.
Responsible for ensuring the risk control system: Risk definition, cost, and the Mitigation Action analysis
Attendance to Executive management meetings, providing and presenting reports and cost-schedule-risk views as required.
Support bid solicitations and project development evaluating engineering, procurement and construction factors that lead to low-cost solutions in a highly competitive environment.
Proactively identify and perform special projects that innovatively solve complex problems with broad impact to the business.
Competencies
Be a role model
Be agile
Collaborate and Share
Develop Self & Others
Empower to grow
Focus to achieve results
Technical Skills
Skills and Requirements

Ability to mobilize team members to deliver projects on time and under budget.
Expert in integrating Scheduling IT tools and software: MS Project or Primavera P6 with costs and resource requirements.
Expert in risk management and mitigation plans.
Expert in utilizing MS Excel for data analysis, budgeting and planning and optimizing schedules.
Understanding of quality assurance processes and implement with project structure.
Knowledge of main configuration and general arrangements of networks (substations, overhead lines and underground lines) infrastructures.
Experienced in contract negotiations and supplier management
Proven experience obtaining siting permits
Ability to manage competing priorities using sound engineering and financial judgment to determine optimal solutions
Deep knowledge of Construction for utility environments or large corporations.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to articulate highly technical concepts and present information effectively at all levels
Strong management and leadership skills, ability to drive change and adoption of new technolog


Education & Experience Required:
Bachelor’s Degree in an engineering discipline (Engineering and/or project management preferred) from an ABET (or equivalent) accredited university/college required and 10+ years of relevant experience, preferably in developing utility scale infrastructure projects.
Or more than 20 years relevant experience in energy industry required.
HVAC up to 500kV and HVDC project management experience.
MBA and PMP, Preferred

Title: Associate Product Manager
Job Description:
Handwashing is the easiest, least expensive, and most impactful solution to protect against the transmission of illnesses that can lead to widespread outbreaks. That’s why we built the only hygiene management system designed to protect businesses and their customers from the unintentional transfer of contaminants by ensuring effective and frequent handwashing. With offices in New York City and Dallas, PathSpot has raised +$10M in venture funding to date and is used daily in more than 40 states and provinces as part of the health & safety routines within industry-leading enterprise brands. PathSpot has been featured as one of TIME’s Best Inventions, a World-Changing Idea by Fast Company, and a leading tool in the industry to prevent the spread of COVID-19.
We are on a mission to revolutionize the way companies and employees track and monitor their health & safety habits by servicing customers in multiple industries. We envision a future where sanitation compliance is as important as business growth.
Team Description:
The product team’s mission is to deliver revolutionary products that exceed our customer needs, paving the path for interconnected products that collect and analyze health & safety data to streamline the way industries operate and serve. As a team, we have a diverse set of skills and love to pick up new ones. Our goal is to ensure every team member has a chance to contribute and take part in any project they may have an interest in. You'll have an opportunity to be involved in hardware, mobile and web design, and define our product roadmap and product marketing strategy.
Role Description:
As an Associate Product Manager at PathSpot, you’ll work with stakeholders across all departments to help design and launch new features for our PathSpot WebApp and Hand Scanner. You will also support the engineering team prototyping additional product lines.
You will be part of all product development lifecycle stages and will be responsible for gathering requirements that address user needs and solve customer challenges
You will help drive the product launch strategy by performing market research and assisting in drafting product documentation and marketing materials
You will work with team members from other departments to help them understand our product changes
You will maintain documentation, style standards, and other guidelines for our products
You are open to learning when you have a knowledge gap – we do not expect experts, but we do expect self-starters
You will execute in both short- and long-term timelines
Ideal Candidate:
Bachelor’s degree in business, computer science, engineering, or equivalent. Commensurate experience demonstrated through employment also acceptable.
Minimum of 1 year of product management or related experience
Excellent organization and communication skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders ranging from marketing to software engineers in an effort to ensure development is aligned with goals
Familiarity with best practices in marketing, branding, and data analysis
High standards for quality and accuracy
Enjoys working both independently and as a team member with proven ability to work with shifting priorities and under tight deadlines
What we offer:
A competitive salary commensurate with experience
Bonus and compensation expansion opportunities through cash and stock options
Medical, dental, and vision insurance
Generous PTO and sick leave
Paid Family Leave
401K Plan
An opportunity to work with a highly motivated team at a rising company and to help build and launch new products!
Compensation Package: $60,000 - $100,000
PathSpot is an equal opportunity employer. We make it our top priority to make sure all people feel welcomed, supported, and connected at work.

Title: Project Engineer
Job Description:
Overview:
Project Engineer - Phoenix, Arizona
Westwood Professional Services, Inc.

Westwood Professional Services, Inc. is seeking a Project Engineer to join our land development operations in our Phoenix, Arizona office. Westwood has a highly experienced and dynamic team of individuals dedicated to providing high-level professional services to our clients.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Prepare site and subdivision plans for residential, commercial, and industrial projects
Experience with stormwater management, storm sewer plans and profiles, outfall analysis, sanitary sewer plans and patterns, water line plans and patterns, water network analysis, public street design, pavement striping, and signage plans
Review local zoning codes, preliminary entitlements, process requirement submittals, and permitting requirements
Assist in maintaining client relationships by providing exceptional services and quality performance through our deliverable
Leadership skills and the ability to meet deadlines and provide high-quality service to the client
Prepares detailed construction drawings using AutoCAD Civil 3D
Identifies applicable codes, standards, or other design requirements
Tracks progress of an assigned task against a defined schedule and budget
Prepares detailed design calculations and analysis
Coordinates with other project staff and associated disciplines and/or sub-consultants such as drainage, traffic, water/wastewater, structural and survey

Mentor and train designers
Performs other duties as assigned

Proficient in Autodesk Civil 3D
Project organization and time management skills

5+ years of experience in land development engineering
P.E. license preferred or EIT with experience
About Westwood Professional Services, Inc. (Westwood):
Westwood is a multi-disciplined national surveying and engineering services provider for commercial and residential development, public infrastructure, wind energy, solar energy, energy storage, and electric transmission projects. Title: Line Services Project Manager
Job Description:
PROJECT MANAGER JOB DESCRIPTION

Position Summary:
As our project manager, you will report to the Operations Manager. Your job will be to coordinate people and processes to ensure that our projects are delivered on time and produce the desired results. You will be the go-to person for everything involving transmission, distribution, substation and civil construction organization and timelines. You will develop detailed plans and procure resources to ensure proper job execution.

Experience/Education:
Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Construction Management, or Five years of practical equivalent PM experience required. Willing to consider experience in substitute for degree.
Five or more years in role of PM is desired.
A Professional Engineer's license or PMP Certification is preferred.
Requires valid driver's license with satisfactory driving record within company insurance standards.
Proficient with Microsoft Office: Excel, Word, Outlook, Projects, PowerPoint, and Blu Beam and with general office equipment.
Experience working with Union employees under a collective bargaining agreement.
Transmission & Distribution line construction estimating

Duties/Tasks:
Responsible for managing construction activities for substations, transmission lines, distribution lines, and civil projects.
Practices cost control, monitors expenditures, reviews task orders, approves invoices and change orders, and provides monthly budget amendments for assigned projects.
Ensures projects are closed and invoiced properly.
Prepares and oversees contracts and manages schedules with clients and subcontractors,
Prepares RFP/bid documents, participates with developing, maintaining and updating department procedures.

Required Skills:
Integrity: exhibits a high degree of integrity and honesty.
Diplomacy: able to use appropriate diplomacy and tact with employees, members, customers and other contacts.
Communication: ability to effectively read, write and speak the English language to communicate in a clear, straight-forward, and professional manner.
Critical Thinking: using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.
Public Speaking: conveying information to an audience effectively through delivery of speeches or presentations.
Active Listening: giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.
Active Learning: understanding the implications of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making.
Problem Solving: identifying problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.
Complex Problem Solving: identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.
Coordination: adjusting actions in relation to others' actions.
Instructing: teaching others how to do something.
Service Orientation: actively looking for ways to help people.
Learning Strategies: selecting and using training/instructional methods and procedures appropriate for the situation when learning or teaching new things.
Negotiation: bringing others together and trying to reconcile differences.
Project Management: organizing and directing production of a limited scope plan or undertaking.
Mathematics: using mathematics to solve problems.
Management of Material Resources: obtaining and seeing to the appropriate use of equipment, facilities, and materials needed to do certain work.
Management of Financial Resources: determining how money will be spent to get the work done, and accounting for these expenditures.
Science: using scientific rules and methods to solve problems.
Confidentiality: able to exercise appropriate discretion and confidentiality

The ability to sit sedentary for extended periods of time
The ability to respond quickly to changes
The ability to see and respond to dangerous situations
The ability to work in extreme weather
The ability to wear personal protective gear correctly

Title: Aerial Field Engineer
Job Description:
Pergam Technical Services, Inc.
Aerial Field Engineer (leak detection and power line inspection March 2023
Pergam Technical Services, an innovator in laser-based aerial gas leak detection systems and infrared power line inspection technology, is looking for a Field Engineer. The mission of Pergam is to enhance pipeline integrity and improve power line safety around the world. The ALMA helicopter-based technology locates methane indications which aids the natural gas industry in reducing loss and improving safety. The infrared power line inspection system is designed to locate and mitigate electrical transmission line safety issues.
This position calls for a candidate who can provide a technical customer service presence for Pergam Technical Services’ clients domestically and internationally. Must be able to travel up to 50% of the time. Must be Seattle-based--no relocation-assistance offered. Must be comfortable in helicopter environment.
The Essential Tasks of the Technical Services/Field Engineer
· Install equipment on helicopters across the nation and conduct inspections at customer pipeline location for extended periods of time.
· Follow-up inspections with written and verbal reports to customer in a timely manner.
· Consult with regional sales department to develop a customer service protocol.
· Field customer requests both in the field and via telephone in the office.
· Assist with sales/technical presentations using power point.
· Support the sales staff as required with customer sales and telephone contacts.
Preferred Qualifications of the Technical Services/Field Engineer
· Prior technical experience, preferably in the aviation field or utility field.
· Experienced in electronics and software, including troubleshooting and field customer support.
· Prior services experience in natural gas or non-destructive testing fields a plus.
· Prior customer service/sales experience a plus.
· Strong understanding of Microsoft office products. (VBA or other coding skills is a plus)
· Ability to prepare mechanical drawings for new products, and modifications.
· Effective communication skills both with customers and co-workers.
· Excellent record of detail orientation and reliability.
· Ability to travel extensively domestically and internationally. International experience a plus.
· Must Pass DOT Pre Employment Drug Test, Subject to Random DOT Drug Testing.
To apply: Send your cover letter and resume to: jwictor@@pergamusa.com

Title: Transmission Lines Engineering Lead
Job Description:
Transmission Lines Engineering Lead

Who We Are
At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. This Opportunity
WSP is currently initiating a search for a Transmission Lines Engineering Lead- High Voltage Transmission & Distribution Discipline for our Boston, MA office. The following locations will also be considered: Rochester, NY, Augusta, ME and Newark, NJ. Be involved in projects with our Energy Team and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.
Leading the Transmission Lines Engineering discipline within our Transmission & Distribution Energy Team
Your Impact

Timely and on-budget delivery of the design packages relevant to their discipline
Responsible for the quality of the package relevant to their discipline

Title: Civil Transmission Engineer I, II, III, IV or Senior
Job Description:
Job Description - Civil Transmission Engineer I, II, III, IV or Senior
We are currently seeking a talented individual for the position of Civil Transmission Engineer I, II, III, IV or Senior. The successful candidate will create engineering designs, construction drawing packages, and related specifications for projects in the assigned engineering group. Performs engineering studies, design calculations and evaluates alternative designs or processes related to, company facilities, land resources, line routing, substations, communication towers, transmission lines, underground electrical systems and associated Civil, Structural and Transmission Standards. Specifies material required for assigned projects and assists in the evaluation of suppliers and products.
Position-Related Responsibilities
Develops, designs and evaluates possible alternatives for substation, communication tower and transmission line projects. The primary design responsibilities encompass site preparation of substation projects, design of transmission lines, establishing structure locations for communication towers or transmission lines, foundation designs, steel structure design, writing material specifications and ordering various structures as needed. Works closely with the project manager from inception to completion.
Uses latest software tools to accomplish assigned tasks including PLS-CADD, PLS-POLE, PLS-TOWER, PLS-CAISSON, MFAD, SAG10, STAAD-PRO, and other tools as are available.
Develops detailed design specifications and standards appropriate for the use in compiling material lists, procurement activities for equipment, materials and services required for project completion.
Evaluates, from an engineering standpoint, vendors, manufacturers, equipment and/or components available to meet assignment specifications and recommends awards that optimize cost and reliability.
Provides budgetary estimates of projects for departmental or interdepartmental incorporation into the Capital Budget.
Develops and monitors work progress on project schedules to assure proper coordination of events during the design, construction, testing and energizing phases of a project.
Initiates job tasks (work orders) and tracks expenditures as may be required to complete Capital Budget project assignments.
Leads formal and informal meetings concerning assigned projects and is able to communicate effectively with all levels of personnel both in the office and field crews.
Consults on problems of a technical nature encountered during various work assignments.
Provide forensic review of failed structure and soil erosion issues to provide technical guidance for rectification as a technical expert.
Reports to the section Engineering Supervisor and performs other assignments as requested.
This position may provide services to affiliates of the Company subject to the UNS Energy Code of Conduct and the related Policies and Procedures.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities (Equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.)
Level I
Description
Will have primary responsibility for small modification or revision projects.
Will assist more experienced engineers in large projects, standards creation or process and procedure creation.
Less than two (2) years professional experience in an engineering role.
Minimum Qualifications
B.S. degree in Engineering
Preferred - Civil/Structural background achieved through training or experience.
Shall have strong analytical capabilities with good personal computer skills.

UNS Energy Corporation
88 E. Broadway
Tucson
Arizona United States

Title: Software Development Engineer
Job Description:
Meinberg USA Inc. - Jobs
Meinberg is a world leader in network time synchronization. Our products are deployed in mission-critical applications around the world including power grids, stock exchanges and banks, live TV and radio programs, air traffic control systems, and hyper-scale data centers. Meinberg products provide time and frequency for hundreds of millions of mobile devices, computers, and communication networks.
In a world of growing complexity with distributed systems, time synchronization is key to accomplish the todays and tomorrow’s challenges of our valued customers. Meinberg is always at the edge of state-of-the-art synchronization technology to provide best value to your valued customers
Meinberg is a German company, headquartered in Bad Pyrmont, Germany with a design center in Vienna, Austria. Propelled by our growth, Meinberg has recently established our US headquarters in Santa Rosa, California and is expanding quickly.
We are looking for:
Software Development Engineer


Job Opening: Software Development Engineer (m/f/d)
Meinberg USA is growing quickly and supports a wide variety of customers in several market segments including power grid, defense, broadcast/media, finance, datacenter, and telecom. Software engineering is a new department of Meinberg USA and branches off the engineering team in the headquarters in Germany and cooperates with the Vienna engineering team.
Meinberg synchronization is used in the power grid in more than 80 countries worldwide. With the move to green energy, power generation is becoming more and more distributed and power flows are more dynamic, requiring accurate and coordinated measurements. As a result, substations are being digitized, requiring precise and complex timing technology, including IRIG, NTP, IEEE-1588 PTP, PRP/HSR, and IEC 61850, and the need for time synchronization is growing consistently.
Job responsibilities:
Integration of software and middleware into our existing LINUX based clock systems.
Programming test cases for our existing Python based system test framework to support our continuous system improvement process.
Support the sales department on technical questions.
As an investment in success, Meinberg will provide training in network time synchronization technology, and Meinberg products. Technical training will include GPS, NTP (network time protocol), and PTP (IEEE-1588 precision time protocol), our complete product line, both hardware and software, and power grid standards (PRP/HSR, IEC 61850, IRIG).
What Meinberg expects from you:
Proficiency in C programming language, data structures, algorithms, and computer science fundamentals.
Experience with Python, system integration, and Linux OS.
Experience with version control using tools such as Git, testing tools and computer systems, and build tools and development processes.
Strong communication skills, good team player.
Dependable and hard working.
Desire to contribute to a growing company and share the work and challenges.
Good to have but not mandatory:
Knowledge about time synchronization technologies.
Understanding of the power grid industry – generation, transmission, and distribution – both technology and industry.
Knowledge about IEC 61850 smart grid technologies.
What Meinberg offers:
Great Life/Work balance
Excellent health insurance
Dental and Vision insurance
401k
Above average PTO
Job Location:
Meinberg USA Inc., Santa Rosa, CA

This position is a great opportunity to join a small and growing team. Meinberg USA has a fun, friendly, creative, and collaborative working environment with a high mix of exciting challenges, the opportunity to learn new skills, and the excitement of wearing many hats.
Meinberg respects and encourages diversity.
Please submit resumes to

Meinberg is a world leader in network time synchronization. Our products are deployed in mission-critical applications around the world including power grids, stock exchanges and banks, live TV and radio programs, air traffic control systems, and hyper-scale data centers. Meinberg products provide time and frequency for hundreds of millions of mobile devices, computers, and communication networks.

Title: Junior Estimator
Job Description:
The Junior Estimator is responsible for delivering safe, cost-effective and quality estimates of mechanical and piping underground; excavation, backfill, civil and sitework; utility piping installations; and above-ground and interior mechanical and piping construction projects. The Senior Estimator manages and compiles all aspects of estimate development including scope, schedule, cost, safety and quality. The Senior Estimator completes estimates by performing a thorough and complete bid analysis reviewing all relevant project data, facts and information, developing a plan for the scope of work involved in the project using sound reasoning and optimal means and methods of construction. The Junior Estimator will perform quantity takeoffs and work with procurement to solicit any required subcontractor and vendor quotes to develop project estimates and proposals.
The Junior Estimator presents estimates to the leadership team, demonstrating competency in all components of each estimate and includes back-up supporting documentation to defend the estimate and the information used to assemble it. Additionally, the Junior Estimator will monitor ongoing Owner and Developer budgets within the industry sector to track upcoming business development and project bid opportunities.
Key Responsibilities/Accountabilities:
Prepares work to be estimated by gathering proposals, drawings, specifications, and related documents
Identifies labor, material, and time requirements by studying proposals, drawings, specifications, and related documents
Performs, or reviews and confirms, estimating and quantity takeoffs
Reviews and confirms quotations from vendors and subcontractors
Interface and coordinate with subcontractors and vendors to develop project estimates and proposals
Analyzes regional labor rates, per diems, and any other relevant market conditions to be used in the estimate
Consults with clients, vendors, personnel in other departments to discuss and formulate estimates and resolve issues
Confers with engineers, vendors and subcontractors to develop Value Engineering ideas to drive project design and economics
Travels to local and regional project sites to understand construction sequence, means and methods, site conditions and perform time-studies
Maintains technical knowledge by attending educational workshops and reviewing technical publications
Assists in miscellaneous functions and tasks to facilitate a growing business group
Provides support and assistance to division management in creating new proposals
Qualifications and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Construction Management, Engineering, Business or related field is preferred; equivalent work experience is acceptable.
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in estimating, or equivalent role; Direct experience with estimating construction projects, preferably focused on piping, underground utility work, with knowledge of excavation and civil-related construction is preferred. Experience in commercial; heavy commercial/industrial; university, aviation, hospital, or other campus related projects and industries is an asset.
Related experience in project execution and operations, such as project engineering and field engineering, is a plus
Skills:
Detailed knowledge of estimating fundamentals
Knowledge of typical costs associated with piping and civil activities
General understanding of Fixed Price, Time & Materials, and Unit contract pricing mechanisms
Aptitude for mathematics; ability to analyze, compare and interpret detailed, but sometimes poorly defined information, and be able to make sound and accurate judgments based on this information
Ability to focus on details, while analyzing and managing larger obstacles
Assertiveness and self-assurance in presenting and supporting conclusions, strong communications and interpersonal skills
Proficiency in project management and the ability to incorporate work-breakdown structure (WBS) techniques in cost estimating complex development projects
Familiarity with scheduling software (i.e., MS Project)
Ability to work under pressure and stress to meet bid deadlines
Strong attention to detail and accuracy to provide accurate estimates to avoid bid/proposal losses or a project money loss on a job
Working knowledge of personal computers and software applications with MS Office application proficiency; experience with estimating software
Excellent organizational, planning, and time management skills with ability to coordinate and prioritize multiple tasks concurrently
Demonstrated skills in written and verbal communications; ability to compose basic as well as complex technical documents and formal letters; ability to effectively verbally communicate and provide presentations with all team members, partners, and stakeholders
Driven and self-motivated problem solver with ability to take proactive initiative to help expand the division’s footprint.
Ability to work both independently and as a collaborative team member.
Company Overview:
Primoris T&D is a full-service contractor dedicated to serving the electric, and telecommunication industry. With over 70 years of operating experience, our collective services include engineering and design, installation and maintenance, material and equipment procurement, and repair of electrical transmission, distribution, substation, and wireless telecommunication. Our collective experience ranges from small engineering and consulting projects to multi-million dollar turn-key distribution, substation, and transmission line programs. https://www.primoriscorp.com/business-units/primoris-distribution-services.
EEO Statement:
We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Third-Party Agency Notice:
Primoris will not accept any unsolicited resumes from any third-party recruiting agencies either domestic or international. Primoris nor its subsidiaries will be responsible for any fees from the use of any unsolicited resumes either through our ATS or via electronic mail systems from any agency representative or agency consultant unless your firm is an approved vendor partner with a current executed agreement.

Job Responsibilities

RF Spectrum Management Engineer - Level 4

Palmdale, California

JOB ID: 632065BR
Date posted: Mar. 14, 2023
Locations: Palmdale, California

Description: Interacts and coordinates with internal and external program and departmental management, subject matter experts, RF engineers, procurement, and radio users across all LM Aero – Palmdale to provide guidance, assistance, and management of radio frequencies to insure all RF emitters are certified, licensed, and operated in accordance to federal government regulations and coordinated, operational, and scheduled requirements.
Uses knowledge of radio equipment, radio emissions, and radio propagation characteristics to review and analyze technical data for accuracy and format for submittal to the appropriate government agency to acquire equipment and platform certification and transmit authorization.
Retains and manages certification and authorizations to insure they are conveyed to the equipment users, for review as needed to prevent internal and external interference issues, coordinate and schedule spectrum use as required, and insure renewal of authorizations when needed.

What’s In It For You
Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually. Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:
Medical
Dental
401k
Paid time off
Work/life balance
Career development
Mentorship opportunities
Rewards & recognition
Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s comprehensive benefits package here.

Palmdale, CA
This position is in Palmdale, CA Discover Palmdale.

Basic Qualifications:
Technical knowledge of radio spectrum and terminology, including:
Transmission, Frequency, Spectrum , Waveforms, Modulation types, Bandwidth, Amplitude, Power, Transmission lines, Shielding Antennas and antenna designs, Polarization
Gain, Coupling, and/or Impedance and impedance matching
Signal reflections.

Basic understanding of aircraft RF emitters including communication radio, navigational aids, radar, data links, telemetry, IFF, electronic warfare, aeronautical navigation, communication spectrum, spectrum allocation, and/or the evolving spectrum congestion.

Knowledge of government regulations and processes including FCC licensing, NTIA RF authorizations, and DoD certification and authorization processes.

Desired Skills:
Knowledge and in depth understanding of the FCC licensing process and the NTIA RF authorization and certification process and related regulations, including Title 47 with emphasis on Parts 5, 15, 87, 90, and 300 (NTIA Redbook).
Familiarity with DD1494, EL-CID, Spectrum XXI, and Government Master File (GMF).
Experience coordinating with national level spectrum management offices including the 88th Communications Group, the Air Force Spectrum Management Office (AFSMO), the Navy and Marine Spectrum Center (NMSC), and Area Frequency Management Offices.

Benefits offered: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, 401(k) match, Flexible Spending Accounts, EAP, Education Assistance, Parental Leave, Paid time off, and Holidays.

This position is incentive plan eligible.

Business Unit: AERONAUTICS COMPANY

Title: Project Archaeologist
Job Description:
Overview:
NV5 (NASDAQ: NVEE) is a provider of engineering and consulting services to public and private sector clients, delivering solutions through six business verticals: Testing, Inspection & Consulting; Infrastructure; Utility Services; Environmental Health Sciences; Buildings & Program Management; and Geospatial Technology. With offices nationwide and abroad, NV5 helps clients plan, design, build, test, certify, and operate projects that improve the communities where we live and work.

As engineers, architects, construction/program managers, environmental professionals and beyond, we play a significant role in shaping our communities through the services we provide. We are looking for passionate, driven individuals to join our team focused on Delivering Solutions and Improving Lives.
Responsibilities:
NV5 is seeking a full-time Project Archaeologist for our Alpharetta, GA or Cary, NC office. This position will complete various types of reports, such as Management Summaries, Archaeological Resource Identification/Survey Reports at the Phase I, II, and III level of investigation, Assessment of Effects, historic contexts, etc. for a variety of clients in the transportation, energy, land development, and municipal sectors. The archaeologist will conduct research, field surveys, and data recovery initiatives to assist in the identification and evaluation of archaeological sites and will complete project tasks within deadlines and budgets. The Project Archaeologist reports to the Senior Archaeologist (Principal Investigator). Location flexibility may be possible for the preferred candidate; one or more positions may be filled through this announcement. The most frequent and essential work activities include:
Conduct Section 106 and/or due diligence assessments for infrastructure and energy projects, as required, including fieldwork/survey, archaeological resource identification and evaluation, and project effects assessment. Evaluations would include field assessments, use of background documentation (i.e. property records and archival research, county surveys, maps, site files, context studies, etc.), delineation of site boundaries using GIS mapping, and photography.
Complete or assist with additional Section 106 tasks, including leading or assisting with consultation (i.e. supporting project consulting parties’ meetings or public meetings, etc.) and project mitigation (i.e. developing data recovery plans and undertaking data recovery efforts, etc.).
Conduct artifact analysis and curation efforts.
Complete other archaeology-related tasks as needed; other tasks could include preparation of proposed avoidance and/or minimization measures for the continued preservation of National Register-listed or eligible archaeological resources.
Manage the performance of individual projects and coordinate with a variety of colleagues, clients, agencies, and the public.
Maintain effective and successful communication with project team, co-workers, and clients.
Assist in business development and marketing efforts, focusing on the development of CALYX/NV5’s archaeological practice in the Southeastern United States.
Assist in business development and marketing efforts.
Qualifications:
Master’s Degree in anthropology, archaeology, or a closely related field
Current standing member of the Register of Professional Archaeologists (RPA) or qualified archaeologist under the Secretary of the Interior’s Professional Qualifications for Archaeology (36 Code of Federal Regulations, CFR Part 61)
Minimum of five years of experience as a professional archaeologist
Minimum of two years of experience as an archaeological field director, Southeastern U.S. preferred
Experience with Microsoft Office and ArcGIS software
Proficiency in utilization of GPS equipment to assist with site boundary delineations
Experience in scheduling and budgeting projects related to cultural resources
Must possess or be able to obtain a valid driver’s license prior to employment
DOT and/or energy-related (FERC and/or Corps-regulated pipelines, transmission lines, etc.) experience preferred
Experience in conducting Native American consultation efforts preferred
Work environment and physical demand of this position
The characteristics described below are representative of those encountered while performing the essential functions of this position. When properly requested and when feasible (without undue hardship to the organization), reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.
Work will be in both field and of office settings with some opportunities to be exposed to adverse environmental conditions.
Fieldwork will involve long-term standing and frequent walking as well as include common hazards at project sites.
Must be able to carry, lift and push/pull up to 30 pounds frequently and up to 50 pounds occasionally.
Must have the ability to see, smell, hear, talk, climb, balance, stoop, kneel and twist, crouch, crawl, reach, grasp, sit, stand, and walk.
Weekend and overtime work and/or overnight work and travel may be required.
Additional physical duties may be required as necessary.
Office work will include working with fingers by picking, pinching, typing and grasping often with repetitive motion.
Must have visual acuity for viewing a computer screen, the ability to talk, hear and sit for extended periods of time.
NV5 offers a competitive compensation and benefits package including medical, dental, life insurance, PTO, 401(k) and professional development/advancement opportunities.

NV5 provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, creed, citizenship status, ancestry, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. NV5 complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Title: Scoping Team – Transmission Line Lead (Multiple Locations)
Job Description:
Description
By aligning individual passions with opportunities, Burns & McDonnell provides unbridled professional growth for the best talent in the industry. Burns & McDonnell is seeking a Scoping Team Transmission Line Lead engineer in our Atlanta office. The scoping team transmission line lead engineer will report directly to the Scoping Manager on a large capital investment program with a major Southeast utility. Other key responsibilities will include:
Responsible for scoping out Transmission line projects. Deliverables at a minimum include a Scoping Package, survey files, and necessary land research documents.
Collaborate with other discipline leads to successfully scope all transmission line work related to Transmission and Distribution projects.
Interface and work with the client’s project management leadership team to provide regular, timely updates and suggest scope options for the client’s approval.
Collaborate with project team to successfully mitigate issues and achieve seamless execution.
Lead Transmission Line Design scoping activities of the team of BMcD employees and/or contractors.
Support estimating and material forecasting efforts.
Qualifications
Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering or related degree from an ABET accredited program or Bachelor of Science in Civil or related Engineering Technology from an ABET accredited program and successful completion of Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) exam.
Master of Science degree in Civil Engineering a plus.
7 years civil engineering experience. EPC project experience preferred.
Professional Engineering License (PE) preferred.
Expert knowledge in standard engineering techniques and procedures. Strong computer skills (e.g., AutoCAD, MicroStation, BIM (Revit), Civil 3D, PLS, PLS-CADD, RISA-3D, MathCADD), and/or hydraulic, hydrologic, pavement, civil analysis programs.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Experience with leading the discipline design for large projects and delegating work tasks to team members. Ability to lead execution of work and resolve issues in a team environment.
Demonstrated critical thinking skills, ability to work methodically and analytically in a quantitative problem-solving environment.
Strong attention to detail, facilitation, team building, collaboration, organization and problem-solving skills.
Ability to perform quality reviews for detailed engineering documents and specifications.
Ability to travel.
EEO/Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans
Job Civil Engineering

Title: Designer I, II & Senior
Job Description:
SUMMARY:

Under minimal supervision, designs, prepares estimates, maps and assembles construction work order packages for distribution, construction, transmission and maintenance projects applying technical and engineering knowledge. May assume lead role for designer group.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Designs all varieties of complex projects such as residential, commercial, industrial, large power and system improvements
Resolves complex complaints including large customer, large generation, industrial, commercial, PRC, and Sr. VP regarding voltage, service, and/or damages
Coordinates complex functions, which vary by area. Complex electric is typically large customer outages, generation design, large industrial and/or commercial projects, major system improvements, and highway relocations. Complexity in other areas involves managing the customer interface in lieu of a Project Leader on all various scopes of jobs.
Undertakes complex special assignments as directed
Prepares resource and cost estimates and assembles complex construction package
Teams with SDP PM for all P3 resources
Coordinates and assesses activities such as right-of-way, permits, environmental screening, etc., related to the project
Obtains permits, reviews other designers' work
Prepares all customer line extension contracts. Reviews other designers work as needed
Prepares and reviews design, obtains "as builts" from C&M department, files manually
May direct the reconciliation of all work orders and variance WO as needed
Provides training and technical assistance to other Designers, and helps establish training needs for other team members
Stays current on technology, policies, and procedures
Takes an active role in making changes to policies and technologies
Solves complex technical issues, multiple-tasks, and multiple projects without direction from Senior Engineers
Equates/trains others on the resolution
Assumes a lead role to other Designers and may assume role as Project Leader when necessary
May perform in the role of an expeditor: coordinating initial customer contact for new electric service installation, removals, relocations, generating customer line extension requests, and processing electric service/yard line orders
Other duties as assigned
COMPETENCIES:
Ability to interpret field notes into a design and estimate
Expert ability to apply engineering and technical principles by designing complex electric distribution system projects
Ability to work with Engineering to guarantee system reliability
Expertise in advanced design, for example: large commercial shopping centers with major anchor stores, industrial customers, network systems, system improvements, large subdivisions that require a system improvement to provide power involving three phase and single phase design, network systems, small commercial, large distribution, large outage, and major upgrades or redesign for joint use collocations
Demonstrated ability to coordinate projects and assume the role of Project Leader using SDP for P3 work
Broad, applicable, advanced knowledge in electric theory and design, and code compliance with basic knowledge of the operation of the other utility where applicable
Extensive knowledge of established Company policies, procedures, and guidelines, including right-of-way and environmental assessment
Expert knowledge and experience in utility design or construction for typical projects in the department. Proposes budgets on annual basis
Broad knowledge of the agency rules and regulations that drive Company policies, design manual, labor database, design standards, and CU compatible units which may include DOT, PRC, NEC, NESC
Ability to provide sustained high levels of effective and efficient customer service, by resolving customer inquiries and/or complaints in a professional and courteous manner

PNM Resources, Inc.
Alvarado Sq
Albuquerque
New Mexico United States
